P__Rq9BmVn1YdvBbY8Le0g.text: Lets start with the fact that - this place is great! Too bad I found out about it only couple of weeks ago. The guys that work there were on a positive note, and those chicken fingers and fries are just delicious, the only thing that I didn't like was the amount of people, the place was full, that's because I came at around 3pm, and that's the time that hungry students get out of school. They need to get a bigger place for sure, because those chicken fingers have a big future! They deserve every star of the five that I put.

zCbkvZe-S_PVa7zjpc7Jqg.text: My go to place to have chicken and fries! The staff is very friendly and even the smallest combo is very filling! I always take friends from out of town here.

mOTzDxwKq9OgQEU93ko_Qw.text: Love this place, it's close to work so we are regulars. Chicken is awesome and they are big wings. Only warning is, if you want to dine in get there before 1130 the place gets packed

ipWApa1loyVn0rubS7B_ng.text: Big portions the chicken wing as well as the fingers were delicious. It wasn't very expensive and I got my food quicker than I expected. I got the hot Sauce on my wings and it wast very spicy but the taste was delicious and went perfect with the ranch. Will definitely be back again!

knbk9RaAIZ4lR5QuD-itOw.text: First  things first - the chicken strips.  Big, juicy, crispy, greasy deliciousness.  I got them plain with bbq on the side for dipping.  Yum.  Shoestring fries also good, the price for the combo is very fair.  Why only 3 stars?  Well, I hate to pile on but previous reviewers are right - the tables/eating area is a dump.  Come on Chicken Shack, either hire someone to clean up the place or have one of your current workers spend a few minutes out of each hour wiping down tables, emptying trash and mopping up.  My shoes were sticking to the floor it was so bad.  I told myself that the cleaning problem was probably just limited to these areas, since I wanted that chicken, but it's not hard to extrapolate and think that the kitchen might not be so great either.  These aren't the kind of thoughts you want your customers to have.

cLuj5mOnaHe0HjP0Cr3rpg.text: I am absolutely in love with this place. I don't know what they do or how they do it but I find myself craving their chicken strips all the time. I would like to try other things on the menu but I feel like if I don't order the chicken strips I will regret it. The habenero honey is my favorite. Also, this place is reasonably priced. Chicken strips, drinks and fries usually come out $6/person.

-TPtmMhYTEPPzYU2HDB6Bw.text: We were recommended this place and since we were on that side of town, we decided to try it. It's in one of those strip mall centers on the corner of Sunset Road. The reviews about this place being small are correct. There are only 6-4 top tables and 3-Deuce tables. The decor and cleanliness is very fitting for the name as it did remind me of a shack with it being small and had that "dirty" look. I'm not sure if it was the floor color or what but, you can decide from the pictures. I couldn't get the whole place because there were obviously people in here.We ordered the 5Finger,fries and drink combo, 10 Fingers and a 3 Finger & 3 Finger,fries and drink combo which all totaled about $30. From the reviews, I was excited to try it because my ultimate Favorite is still Raising Canes even over Chic-Fil-A... have yet to try PDQ. I must say that I was not impressed. The fingers were bland and the fries tasted like straight oil. Perhaps our chicken would've had flavor if I didn't ask for sauce on the side(another tip I got off of here) but, even with the sauce on top, I'm sorry but, it still only qualifies for a ranking of 3stars. On a good note, the fingers are a very good size hence, the reason why I'm giving 3 stars and not 2. I would be willing to give a 5 if this place were bigger, cleaner and tastier.

Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

Tscoq9kue8_J1ySO42_ItA.text: This is our new go to wing joint, and let me just get this out of the way...This place serves some big ass wings!!! My husband and I crack up every time, wondering where the hell do they get these chickens?!  Soo.. big juicy, crispy well cooked wings and delicious sauces. (we've only tried a few so far) The chile-lime was yum, the habanero honey was sweet/spicy heaven for me. Both kids like the honey bbq, and occasionally we order the dry spiced wings for when we don't feel like getting down and dirty. They have lemon pepper and garlic parmesan, both good. The fries are super skinny, and that's a nice change...very crisp.  So why not 5 stars? I hate that they offer big packages, 25, 50 or 100 wings but you may only have 2 different flavors in those packages. I don't know if it's like that at other places or not, but regardless, I think it's lame.  The second reason is that there are always dirty tables. Every time we've been, we've searched for the least dirty table and watched the other ones sit there un-wiped for the duration of our stay. You may be  understaffed due to the economy, but the tables have to be wiped down. No one wants to sit at someone else's mess. On the bright side, you can phone in your order, walk in and pick it up and bypass the dirty tables.

ZWTXrkMmVr7WQqvFhk9aYw.text: Wow good.  Not to diminish the Chicken, but the French Fries are out of this world.  Hardest choice in ordering is what type of sauce for your wings and fingers - there are so many choices.

RVI09Xq6PKmXXOxcbo9s5w.text: This place is down the street from me so I decided to try it. The fries are scrumptious, thin & crispy the best! The fingers are large, the sauces are yummy! It could use a real good cleaning inside, but it is, what it is and for a yummy quick bite to eat, I like it! I have to try some other items next time! I will be back.

EJz-b1N2RLJL-jHVoBGGKg.text: Shopping next door at Smith's for some time, we had seen the signs for Chicken Shack for some time. One day, our preshopping hunger was going to cost us way too much money in the grocery store, so, we decided to give the Chicken Shack a try.  We both got the chicken finger and fries, with a fountain drink for both of us. Looking at the menu, if I was a fan of wings (too much work, not enough food) I could see myself diving into their AYCE wings. With such a wide selection of sauces available, you could eat your fill and still not have tried all of their sauces (maybe).  Our food came out pretty quickly, and tasted quite good. My main complaint is that the fryer oil appeared to be very old, as our fingers were dark and a bit tough. The high level of grease soaked into the batter was bordering on being too greasy.  That won't be our last visit, I hope to give them a shot, and see if we can time it to be near when they change the fryer oil.

9r6TnNOATOJ0dFcDqsb8lA.text: Food is great I've been going there since freshman year of high school back in 2008. Today I had the worst customer experience of my life. I asked the cashier "When you have a moment could you please come wipe out table down its kind of sticky" the place was dead and he wasn't occupied but he never came. Ok I thought no worries. Our food was delivered to us by another gentlemen by the name of Daniel. I asked Daniel "Could you wipe the table down for us when you get a chance" he replied "sure". As he walked away with his back turned to he says "a please would be appreciated " in a completely passive aggressive tone. He's right I should have said please but that doesn't change the fact that he was being completely unprofessional. When he came back I proceeded to address the situation as he comment made me feel really uncomfortable. I told him hey I don't appreciate being spoken to In such an aggressive manner. He then proceeded to argue and escalate the situation in a completely immature way. Cherry on top when our argument concluded he followed it up with "cool story bro" that really got my blood boiling. I'm not one to complain but I felt the need to get a manager involved at this point. Their employee had disrespected me and was being completely unprofessional. When I spoke to them they mocked and asked me what they should do "sit him down and give him a stern talking to" with a huge grin on their face. They essentially blew me off and expect me to believe that will address the situation with the runner? Yea, I don't think so. It wasn't until another runner came out from the kitchen and acknowledged the situation and explained that Daniel can be a bit of a dick. It isn't my fault that's he's a dick or is having a bad day. They shouldn't take it out on their customer and if he can't deal with customers then he shouldn't be working in the customer service industry. I can honestly say that I will not be returning to chicken shack not after the complete disregard they showed for customer satisfaction.

2o26L_RhJpFbgwGWX3_MCQ.text: Had another craving for good chicken wings...thought I'd update my thoughts.  There's something about the batter on the chicken pieces that makes it taste so good...it's also spattered all over the fries.  It's just a nice, greasy, deliciously unnutritious meal.  I have to slightly recommend the wings over the fingers though, as the fingers are a little thick and dry.  I tried the BBQ and mild sauces this time, and the mild was nasty.  I'm not a hot wing guy, so I'd definitely recommend sticking with the honey BBQ or teriyaki sauces if you're anything like me.  TIP: The fingers taste better if you let them marinate for a few minutes in the styrofoam "to go" box on the way home...a lot juicier and tastier than dining in.

dnLvwr_4gqJv75qygBhhhQ.text: Based on my first experience I this place gets four stars. It could swing either way though. The chicken sandwich was very tasty. The fries are the second best I've had next to Sammie's LA pastrami. It is a little pricey $8.10 for my sandwich. The honey BBQ actually taste like it has honey in it. Once I've tried more I will probably change this review.

Y_EMSaCnCn2GkLENDuzvgg.text: Best chicken in Vegas! I have been coming here for 10+ years and the owners will make you feel right at home. The chicken is delicious and the  salads are fantastic, fyi don't forget to order the fries.

SuGPEQMWOe_LNDIoVwo_7A.text: Place was good enough that i'd come back. Chicken was just a little salty. Really enjoyed the fries with that fry sauce. The dude who was runnin the desk seemed like good people, other than being a Cubs fan lol. Gotta support local mom and pop joints like this though!

XDQqvd_wq9AK8s9PcWd6HQ.text: Consistent, cooked to juicy perfection, crispy, tons of sauce options, delicious shoestring fries, very generous portions, and your plate will be ready before you get a chance to sit down and pull out your phone. If you're a fried chicken fanatic then this place is where you will find the best bang for your buck as well as your palate. If only there was another location in Vegas!!!

RDvEz1tJJTnWNoLTkI17ww.text: Good food but store closes early? Showed up saturday night 10 minutes before closing.employee had the door open moping telling my self and another customer they closed at 8:30.the other customer said he phoned down and a staff member said they closed at 9! I personally went down because yelped told me it closed at 9! Whats going on?

CGqjmaqDqZYACS2MR5QNSA.text: One of the best local places, they serve big and juicy pieces! And not to mention their fries! They might be a bit thin but they're really good and taste fresh.

1hCyaj2I6_h1SnlMj_FFIw.text: We got our order to go, but the wings were still crispy and juicy. The fries (strings) were ok, my partner in crime told me they used to have thicker fries and wondered why we had strings this time. Doesn't matter the wings and company made up for it.

vHsvJIUclumZmTKeYAhJbg.text: Dude, this is some awesome fried chicken! Jesus, I love it! The breading is just perfect, not too heavy and the chicken is so moist. I don't know how they do it. The fries are nice and crisp and salty and accompany the chicken so well.   The restaurant is a little hole in the wall, things can get pretty cramped in there. It's a place to grab you chicken, eat it fast and get out there. If you do take it home though it is also tasty; with some places the fries would get soggy but these retain their crispness.  It's damn good fried chicken. Nuff said.

1nW0tQ3s2JQXuIjpFiBgzA.text: Amazing!!!! These are the BEST wings! Small little place but the chicken is freaking amazing. I get so excited when I order from here. They are fast too. The garlic parmesan dry wings are my fav! My husbands the honey bbq and my daughter. I do not enjoy the fries but they wings are to well worth it.

sfyOqN9799Zdj0HJ24zI2w.text: Ordered the # 2 combo, medium heat.  Overall it was really good, great value.  The chicken fingers were perfect, no "questionable" bites.  The fries were addicting - I kept eating and eating and eating them, even after I was full.  The only comment I have is that the chicken fingers looked like sauce was dumped on them, I'd rather have them tossed in sauce so the sauce covers 100% of the chicken.  Other than that it was a great meal, I will be back for lunch again!

K9t0XYQ_iX97lasp8sQ4Cg.text: Ordered the #1 and while the wings were cooked well and the fries were crisp (love them this way), their food is ruined by whoever is responsible for salting the food because my food was overly salted. I couldn't finish my food because all I can taste is salt. I hope next time, if here is a next time, the food won't be overly salty.

ylwIiCSGtG0ytShasNmsUQ.text: I think I've been here enough times that I should finally be giving it a rating.  So far, I've pretty much only had fingers and fries combos. Three fingers is the right size if you're alone, unless you're super hungry. Five is a bit high unless you're sharing with a friend or two, Sometimes, they'll throw in an extra finger if they think that your pieces are a little small.  I have to start with the fries. They are the best shoestring fries I've had anywhere. There's just something to the flavor that draws you in. Don't put ketchup on them though. I don't know why, but that destroys the flavor for me. You can dip them in sauces (see below).  And of course, the chicken fingers are the main point of the restaurant. They are large. They are crunchy. They are tender. And they come with dry or wet sauces (note: get wet sauces on the side if you don't want to destroy the crunchy texture of the fingers). Come back multiple times and try many sauces.  I have no darn clue why there isn't a lemon-lime soda option here. That's the only negative that I have to share. I would probably just get a small cup for water if I could, but a drink comes with the combo.

vGfyyS3rpOfUaLT5d3sIEQ.text: Best chicken fingers in Las Vegas! Always fresh, never frozen. This place is almost always busy so don't mind if you have to wait a minute, worth the wait. The ranch dressing is made fresh in house as well as lots of other sauces. A local gem that you should definitely check out!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. 3 fingers &amp; fries with ranch &amp; blue cheese on the side

WQsHrhWni_oaRzjX5MStZg.text: Chicken shack is amazing! Our go to place for chicken and wings! Casual ambience. Quite the hole in the wall place.   Chicken shack is a great treat. They have an amazing variety of sauces and they all taste great!! This is the #1 wing place hands down. No question.

gKh6h0tXRBb0_LhdRI_HjQ.text: Anybody who grew up in the area knows Chicken Shack is a staple. Great food for the money you pay, plus they're lightning quick with getting your food out to you. Even on days the line stretches to the door, I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes to get my food. Often enough, they have it ready before I can even put the lid on my drink.   The ranch is top-notch, as are their fries. And quite often, you'll get more than what you ordered.

IJZaMbHZSafCEF88o-XTWw.text: Good homemade chicken strips they were bigger then expected! A lot of seasonings and dip kids loved it!

MLfakxpWIDzwzCtlmraXBQ.text: Makes raising canes on lake mead and i95 on the run.  Then again it is good place to go since I work at SandHill and Patrick.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Number 3 with honey mustard

QcViOnWvEZzei6hWtEmbRg.text: I don't entirely know why, but I'm kind of obsessed with Chicken Shack. I'm rarely on that side of town, but have noticed it on my way to Ross J's. It looked kinda ghetto so I stayed away till a couple weeks ago when Ross J's was closed early. I'm glad I tried it because I'm a little addicted now.  I'm probably kind of biased because their plain wings taste just like when my mom makes korean chicken before she dips it in the sauce. Nostalgia is a funny thing, but I do think they're also just really good wings.   Price is about $1/wing and many have mentioned that's overpriced, but that seems standard to me for restaurants - BWW is about the same. Chicken Shack also has huge drummies and wings, not broken or midget ones like a lot of other places. I'm a fatty, but I was full off of 6 wings because they're bigger and meatier.   For sides, we've tried the cole slaw, baked beans, and fries - only the fries were really good crispy shoestrings, I'd pass on the rest and just stick with wings. For sauce my fav is the habanero honey (not that spicy) and garlic parm. The bbq and sweet chili were pretty standard, but I also liked the wings just plain because they had seasoning already.   Service was great and the tables were clean the 2 times that I've been, with guys coming out to wipe down tables as soon as they're free. I hate nickel and diming - they charge for ranch/blue cheese and extra sauce, but what can you do.  I also agree with others who've said that their chicken fingers are dry - stick with the wings.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Really good crispy wings - dont even need sauce, but got it on the side. 25 wings w 2 lg sides and 4 drinks for $32
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. #1 combo - 5 fingers w sweet chili sauce &amp; super crispy shoe string fries $8.50. Slightly dry chicken

nIln4XhymqnLjUh_9K-mLQ.text: Was skeptical about trying this place at first. Tried it and it was ok. I got the number 4 which is 3 wings, 3tenders, fries and drink. Simple meal to start off with a new restaurant . The fries were good. The chicken was juicy but I feel as tho they could cook their chicken wings and tenders just a bit longer, give it that crisp. And it could use some more seasoning, wasn't impressed with the seasoning on the food at all. So decent spot but it won't be somewhere that I'd set out to go to in future unless by passing.

HKDX9KkOag_4zUl1OKObsw.text: A friend told me about this place. Small little quaint restaurant, but dont let the outside fool you. If chicken is what your really craving, I'd come to this place any day over buffalo wild winsg.  The wings are twice the size of buffalo wild wings. Sounds like a bold statement but u gotta try it and you'll know what i mean.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

RkPHNVnPN7OfTfrakAZweA.text: Not a huge fan. Stopped in passing through town craving some wings. The portions were huge. Salad, fries, wings, all of it was huge.  The wings themselves were not great. The wings were really big which made them not taste as good. In my opinion, good wings need to be smaller, that way you get more of the sauce to wing ratio. Not only that, they tasted old. Not impressed, should've gone to BWW.

2P0ulfaIAqHAX_8hzD-CKg.text: I'm going to make this plain and simple. Don't get your wings tossed in sauce here. Keep the sauces on the side and dip your chicken rather than having it all over. They do not try to be like wing stop or BBW and we should all respect that. But they offer tossing you sauce for you anyway. Also another tip don't eat here it's small and busy so it's best to get in line order Togo and take it home. I love their chicken wings and dipping sauces Mild sauce and sweet chili and garlic Parmesan are my go to sauces but I will try more next time. The wings are a good size and cooked perfectly. They don't overcook it like BBW to the point where you get a mini wing. One of my fave spots to stop when I'm on this side for sure. They seem to be putting out a great product but I think they need more space to operate more smoothly.

XCMczpSows0Df8AqnuBOqg.text: The food was great but the service was terrible. The cashier told my friend that we had to take our food to go because they're closing in 40 minutes. Then when I was about to order she had the nerve to have a whole conversation with her boyfriend on the phone before talking to me, haha.

VZOBNNCvQekE8HFhKSAzyg.text: I have been coming here for over 10 years now! Boy, do I feel old. There chicken never disappoints, whether you want fingers, wings or even both. There is a ton of different sauces to choose from and they are continuously adding new ones to try. For my money, it's the best chicken place around. My orders here are very eclectic, but I'd say my favorite is the Hot BBQ with a side of Hot teriyaki and spicy bleu cheese. It might sound a little strange, but even if you're just dipping their delicious fires in the teriyaki, it's totally worth it.

dbwcKo3YGX7bS8A4Wp-tRg.text: Absolutely some of the best chicken I've ever had. So flavorful even with out the sauce which is very important when it coomes to chicken, because most chicken eateries the chicken is very bland and this chicken hands down tops all chickens joints rasing canes wing just STOP ain't nothing on THE CHICKEN SHACK puts them to shame. If they ever decide to move it down to LA they would make a killing....can't wait to go back so I have some on our road trip home

yTh2Ije3sJ_kByriBPULag.text: Best customer service in town! Told him it was my first time at his restaurant and he took care of me real well. BEST FINGERS IN TOWN!

tevVi0dipQ_BVCEQ9ySQJg.text: An amazing place in a store front complex who not only serves amazing fingers with a variety of choices of sauce, but also sells beer, so you have have amazing wings or fingers with a beer, what a deal in a small store front environment.  The food is actually very good and the staff extremely friendly.  It really does not matter if it is your first time or you have been many times, you are treated like you have been coming there for a long time and they are always happy to see you.  I like this place and highly recommend this place if you are looking for a snack or a meal, either way it is a place worth trying.

TnJL14UA2mMjjDji-HvHzw.text: Located near the intersection of Sunset Rd. and Mountain Vista, which I like to think of as "old Green Valley." This place is definitely a beaut that contributes to the other mom and pop owned places in the area. Chicken Shack was a typical eating spot for me while I was attending USN because my classmates and I would come here during our lunch breaks or after school before we would get our study on. And yes, all the raving reviews are correct. From what I've tired, probably the best chicken wings in LV, so this place is a MUST TRY!   I've noticed that I am a tough critic when it comes to the breading because Raising Canes is a little thin, while KFC is so thick I just opt to peel all the breading off. However, Chicken Shack has the perfect amount of thickness and also has nice crispy texture. Seasoned very well and they offer different types of flavors too like Wing Stop or BBW. The fries are also delish, thinly cut with extra crispies (almost the same as Yard House fries). They also have an all you can eat chicken option for $12.99, but I don't exactly know what it comes with. But I found that interesting because I've never seen such a thing at a chicken place. The only down side is you have to pay extra for ranch or blue cheese, which in my opinion kinda sucks.   I really like the mom and pop vibe of this place with the friendly staff and decorations.They even have their specials written on a chalk board. All of it really makes everyone feel welcomed.

Nr5epJV3VVYiHRfLDP7PtA.text: Ive been going  to  the chicken  shack in  henderson  on sunset the service is awesome  and if i could i would  give a 10 out of 10 the reason is because  of  one young lady that works there she is awesome  her name is Priscilla shes always friendly  and she always has a smile and the food is great thanks chicken  shack for making it a wonderful  experience  for my family  and  I

xC4tz0lRPp1MzVN4cGPVpw.text: I used to crave this place, last two visits the chicken has been tougher and on the dryer side. Not sure if they changed the type of chicken or it's the cook.

YYutJ_FqXSJubKyzn4AvJw.text: I am not a huge fan of this place. The food is way salty which is good for some people at some times(the bf loves salty ass food), but my firm belief is if you sell food, don't nickel and dime for stuff that makes YOUR food better. For example, making me pay a side price for some (veggie sticks)celery and carrots, ridiculous. Celery is literally a dollar for a giant bunch. Charging for ranch? At a dedicated chicken wing place? Wha??? I mean, where is any logic there?? If you want more than one type of sauce, charge. I mean really...  I am a frequent craver of chicken wings, fingers, anything crunchy and salty with some hot sauce and celery. The celery is a must. I still think it is  a travesty that some fast food pizza places have the audacity to serve wings and yet do not carry celery. I frequented this place a lot at first, but after a while spending over ten bucks a pop for a single meal just so I can get some celery and ranch with my meal is ridiculous. Now I just head over across to (casino takeout)...which is good but I would rather support small business.

VS6TC8_sBNxbo0-spaBRtg.text: I use to work near by so if I was getting lunch this was usually the 2nd place I would pick. When I would go I usually got the 3 piece finger meal, believe me it's enough to make you full without being over stuffed.   It comes with 3 large sized chicken fingers, shoestring fries, a sauce, and drink.    I don't know what seasoning they put on the  fries but the are the most scrumptious fries I've ever had, and I hate shoestring fries.   I always get the sauce on the side. I get the honey mustard sauce, which costs a bit more but I don't mind because its like crack!  I'm really not a fan of their buffalo sauces something is off putting about them.  What I love most is that it's quick, tasty, real chicken fingers, AND they have sweet tea (that alone pulls at my southern girl heart strings)

_WyKZl7lEAfd548PUFNzGA.text: Been here a few times and they've always been very nice and fast. If there's a line it usually isn't for long because they're very prompt.  They have some cool menu options and the food tastes really good.  The only slight drawback is the size of the location.  It's intimate but small and the front cash area can get very congested.  I do suggest trying the Pitcher of beer and wings combo deal.

Fvttp_xgX3kiOuciOa53Gg.text: Chicken Shack offers great chicken for an affordable price! They really give you your money's worth. I got the combo with 5 chicken strips and shoe string fries. You get one dipping sauce for free and each one after that is $0.35 more. I got Habanero Honey and Sweet Chili which were both pretty awesome. The chicken strips are large and filling - I couldn't even finish all of it. They are cooked perfectly to a crisp! The shoestring fries were tasty as well :) I definitely recommend this place for a quick dine-in or pickup!

LECNBscSsI3jg5IODyIIpg.text: Chicken Shack had some scrumptious chicken fingers. I especially liked the chicken, which was not dry and fairly juicy. They got that right. I just wish the coating was a bit more crispy, but I liked the chicken so much that it wasn't a big deal. It was a bit pricey, but you got a lot of food. There was no way I was going to eat all that in the combo, which came with a ton of fries. The service was friendly and unbelievably fast. It was lunch time and there were a lot of people in line. A few minutes after I placed my order and was getting my drink, a man came out with my food. Wow, I never had food brought out that fast!

7xEm8VxpTdswWuCsLLT-lw.text: Great chicken but greasy! They even throw in 1 or 2 pieces extra depending on how large of a fingers order you get. Kinda of irriatating to have to pay extra for some of the sauces though since they aren't included in their reguilar sauce list. And then they don't even fill the containers more than half full when you've paid extra for them. I suppose when I am in the mood for chicken & in the nieghborhood I might stop in again.

DcnL-VQcKZn_HbsrRRoE0A.text: I love the Chicken Shack! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is great all the staff seems to be pretty knowledgeable and very attentive!

sJjKHKMoRqPXmWlXCGvZZw.text: I'm a frequenter at The Shack and I'll tell you first hand it is quality chicken at a doable price. The first time you try Chicken Shack you will fall in love. Chicken Shack is a definite go-to spot when you're muddled on where to have a bite or if you're coming in for a visit. Chicken Shack is by far one of the finer chicken eateries on the west coast. Would recommend this place to the most loathing person of chicken. Great atmosphere, definite 5 star.

-6gHwX5bc8MP2tEL6Mln0A.text: Chicken tenders are awesome! I love all the sauces that come with it as well. The prices aren't that bad especially on how good the tenders taste. I really loved the service, thank you(: I wish there was a chicken shack closer to my area, the drive down to Henderson side is too far..

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. I want more chicken tenders!!!
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken tenders are so yummy with there sauces, especially honey mustard!

jMIrqziyoZ5KaSCYZPLNgA.text: The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because the past 3 to 5 times I've had run ins with my order. I asked for the chicken to be fresh and not super crispy or in other words dark brown. I got my order in a matter of 5 minutes and was not happy. I took it back and kindly asked for it not to be super dark and the lady at the cashier (short black hair, white Mexican looking, with gauges) rudely said "that's how they are cooked". I just asked to get another batch and she said "that's just be oil" but I've been in the food industry. The oil needed to be changed or filtered. Ive only had issues with this one cashier. Then I go to get fruit punch Gatorade and it was out. I kindly told her it was out and she said okay and didn't do anything about it. I was there for 30 minutes and asked her 3 times and nothing got done. Chicken shack is a great place but not recently. Very disappointing with the service.

fTy3Q6-UvNqR47nskE2iMA.text: Chicken shack is a great place to grab some wings. All the sauces are excellent and the chicken is phenomenal. The best in Vegas. If they could brake the habit of serving old fries (cause we know the difference) then they would be a 5 star spot. I'd rather wait a few more minutes for fresh fries rather than fast food with old fries.  Other than that we are 3 years loyal.

jiOd1UyIcB12y-10TEY26A.text: Friendly staff and great food! I do recommend this place to others. The fries are not too salty which is good. My bf took me to this place, my first time. I love the chicken fingers and the medium buffalo sauce on the side. :)

FV80oc2OE86Lewj6isnxtA.text: Always a pleasant and satisfactory meal at chicken shack, this time was no difference. Had the #1 wings with jerk sauce on the side, perfectly cooked and delicious. Partner had the #2 finger meal, a bit over cooked but overall satisfied. Cheap beer, cheap wings, good sauce. Nothing else to say but bring some towelettes. Recommend wing sauce on side if you are taking out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Why did the chicken cross the road? Because he was a cannabalist
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. #1 and #2

rQLKZvjLbmNL8Np9BEIJYg.text: Okay, finally tried this place. In short, it was okay. Not worth going out of your way to go to, but if you're in the neighborhood, stop in and try it. Service is exceptional, very friendly. And I wish I could say that the food was stellar...but it wasn't. It was okay.

Hrj840SvJ2eGTKClBBKgdw.text: Awesome chicken wings! Ordered 6 wing combo with fries and a drink and I was so full! Crunchy wings with great sauce on the side! Great and fast service! Will go back again!

-13cPYWua1Rv_bTaNJ4uQw.text: Amazing food and wonderful customer service.  I can't stop bragging about this place!!

iSMC8MogaPNH1lPus00U8A.text: Great prices and great food. the wings and legs are large sized so dont order too much.

mHBDXoRlDdV1VljFktWEMA.text: Here's the deal with this location located on Sunset Rd.   The chicken is good as long as it's not overcooked. In my experience of going to this location at least a dozen times it's about a 50/50 chance of whether the chicken will be really good or flat out burnt. I have learned to ask for the chicken to be cooked on the spot and to say "don't overcook it."   The manager has not been very professional on a couple of occasions. She basically didn't want to hear about the problems in her store and just proceeded to talk over me. I wasn't to happy about this, but I did like the chicken so I was eventually willing to overlook this and she was more professional on visits thereafter.   What really pissed me off big time was on my last and final visit. The girl who works the register (heavy set, short dark hair, butch looking) did something which I find pretty bad. We ordered our food, I sent my 17 year old autistic child up to the counter with a $1 bill to buy an extra dipping sauce which is 59 cents or there about. He gave her the $1 bill, yet she didn't give the kid any change. She just kept it. We are only talking about .40 cents or so, but that's not the point! She knew the kid didn't know any better and she took advantage of it. I walked up and said something, but she acted as if she didn't know what I was talking about.  For these reasons and mainly the last, I will never return to this location ever again. The employee who did this is constantly on her phone, tables are dirty, floors and walls are dirty, yet she stays on her phone instead of cleaning.   This has been my experience, yours may vary.

qV6HtHFfFpZ8KDSNAR9QHg.text: It was 7pm, I was jonesin' for some chicken, didn't want to cook, so I looked to Facebook and my fellow yelpers for good places to grab some chicken. The reviews for this place were great, and a lot of my friends cursed me out because I have lived here for 4 years and never tried this place.   First things first:  Pros: Short drive from my house Cheap combination plates Festive decor   Cons:  Was a little put off at the guy mopping the floor while I was eating.   The food is amazing!! And they give you a LOT of it. I ordered the #4, 3 chicken fingers,  3 wings, fries & a drink (with ranch)  $10 & some change. The fries, shoestring, are so good and seasoned (which is rare out here cause everyone is afraid of seasoning). I couldn't even finish. Ate 1 finger and one wing, handful of fries, and I was done. Will definitely return, definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. The #4 3 chicken fingers, 3 wings and fries

l-TUxjspvhQcqeJlB5PbCA.text: I had to visit the Chicken Shack because I was craving their chicken fingers. I've been here a few times before, but I finally took the time to visit again and write a review.  Inside, the walls are decorated with license plates from different states. It has a pretty cool feel to the place, but it can get crowded given the fact that it is small.  Since I was buying food to feed 4 people, I ordered the shack pack (your choice of 25 wings OR 20 fingers, two large sides, and 4 drinks for $34.99). I opted for the chicken fingers and chose the macaroni salad, potato salad, and the coleslaw for my sides (I decided to get an extra side item instead of the 4 drinks).   The chicken is supposed to be their showcase item, but it ended up being more of a letdown. The fingers are a good size for what you pay for and they're juicy when you bite into them, but the fingers I got tasted like they had been cooking in old oil (it wasn't that pretty golden-brown color, but more on the darker brown side). The sides were alright. The macaroni salad and potato salad were the better of the sides. Unfortunately, the coleslaw looked like it was put in a blender before serving. It was more on the sweet side and really watery.  They didn't deliver on the wow factor, but I'm willing to give Chicken Shack another chance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. indoor/front counter.
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. close-up.

65xL_pmeULsgXQGPv98Q5Q.text: The chicken is really good and so are the fries. It's too bad because this place is pretty gross inside. Food all over the floors, sticky table tops, a single trash can that looks like it's been there since they opened the place. Woman wearing a backwards ball cap at the register is super rude, I've been brought here by some friends a couple of times and she's always been working. She's very short and makes you feel stupid if you can't hear what she says as she mumbles questions to you. You can tell she doesn't want to be there as you compete for her attention with her cell phone.   Bottom line the food is great. But I don't think it's worth the bad customer service, and I mean it's a chicken place, it's not that hard to take an order. It's so dirty in there too. They have other locations so just go there instead of this one.   **Update** they have a new team and have cleaned the place up. It's perfect.

LP0hA7hXpqVaz-9Lztjjow.text: We arrived a bit early to see Mad Max at the Galaxy Luxury Theater, so we decided to find something to munch on to kill the next hour. We found a few places nearby on Yelp! and saw the solid reviews for The Chicken Shack and decided to check it out!  What i liked...  - Had an order of chicken wings and an order of chicken fingers, serving size was generous and both the wings and fingers were plump and meaty! I like! - they do give you a generous portion of ranch sauce, but if you wish to have an additional or different sauce there is an extra charge for that - Beer on tap for decent prices, especially compared to what you will get at the movie theater. - very fun and chill atmosphere with the 90's music playing and funny little phrases adorning the walls plus a ton of license plates and other unique little things - Service was pretty quick, and they were pretty busy when we were in there  What I didn't like...  - tables were not very clean. Having someone just wipe the tables down between customers would make a big difference - customer service was spotty. Some of the guys were very friendly while others would barely speak  - this place is very small and when it gets busy, it can feel cramped quickly  Others items to note..  - their soda fountain consists of Pepsi products - this seems to be a very popular spot for the high school/college aged crowd. Nothing wrong with that. Merely an observation. Lots of "dude", "man", and "bro"'s were being flung about recklessly.  I really am so back and forth between 3 or 4 stars on this place. The wings were nice and plump, but lacked any kind of seasoning or flavoring. The chicken meat on the fingers were excellent! I will definitely be back to try out more menu items and snag some more of those chicken fingers! After a couple more visits, I could easily see myself bumping this up to 4 stars. For now though, I like the Chicken Shack, but it's just..  A-OK.  3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

4647Pv3oht_pjuFMzJE5_A.text: Heard good things but was totally disappointed chicken came out burnt fries were cold and the server acted like he/she (couldn't tell) didn't care about their job at all! Will not be going back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

3SrPTt9gzx5C3oIWzHStJA.text: I would generally give a thumbs up because i usually have a good experience. But not tonight! We ordered 20 piece to go with fries. We asked for bbq. Our chicken tasted stale, fries were soggy, and the bbq sauce was straight water. If they cant afford to give bbq sauce, charge me 50 cents. Dont serve garbage.

IXaWUE5ac7n1g7h23N3O7w.text: Shack attack!   From the first time we set foot in Chicken Shack to the present, it's been our favorite place for wings.  I have a catch phrase of 'Shack Sunday' because we always come here to get our wings during football season.  They open at 10 so it's perfect for game time. They are located off of Sunset in the Smiths shopping plaza so it's easy to find with ample parking.    Now let's get down to business- the wings here have stayed consistently huge, succulent and flavorful.  They offer a huge variety of sauces for the wings.  All are great.  The hot sauce and the honey habanero are our favorites.  You can choose to have them tossed in the sauce or on the side.  Tip- if you're carrying out, get the sauce on the side and toss them yourself when you get home.   I hate to leave out mentioning the over addicting shoestring fries.  They do not skimp on these tasty sides.  The BBQ baked beans are also a favorite of mine. It's always a tough choice of mine which side to get.    Customer service is reliably top notch. They treat us like one of their friends every time.  They are always friendly and make a point to say hi even during a busy time.  I always appreciate their kindness as well as the amazing food.    Any day is always a great day for wings!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Love it!
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken Shack Salad

edjFZTvyvX8OIi7kJzB_Uw.text: Fast and Friendly service! The food came out quick and freshly made. Definitely coming back here again!

pRZlu2ZWufp1e3v-I_4W9g.text: I usually enjoy the fried chicken fingers but i opted for the chicken salad today. What a bad decision. The chicken was so dry and overcooked. It was shredded up while they chopped it up. I tried to use ranch to make up for the dry chicken but had no luck. I used one and a half ranch cups on less than half the salad and it was still dry! It had 3 pieces of sliced cucumber and 5 cherry tomatoes atop a bed of chopped romaine lettuce and two pieces of red onion. It was sprinkled with croutons and cheese which was probably the best part.   I had some of my bfs chicken fingers and fries and they were good. That Chicken was dry as well and the batter was soggy. Dipping it in the honey mustard seemed to remedy the problem.   Overall, i recommend ordering ahead so you dont have to wait in line. The dining area is way too small and hot. The fried chicken fingers and fries are good, but i personally prefer Raising Canes any day.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. The chicken salad

gl88MBNySL6illhhyVKDeQ.text: Make sure your order is prepared fresh. Ordered a 25 wing meal from the location on Sunset and Green Valley Pkwy. My order was over the phone and my first clue should have been when the person taking my order said that "my order would be ready in 6 minutes". The chicken was dry and obviously filled w/ old wings!! Chicken would have potentially been better if fresh??!!

aPKiIxVj-7xMoZ2J30woYg.text: We loved the food. quantity and quality of the food is really good.  Service is prompt.

kN1npe0Zt362gTmuyB8ySg.text: This location is always busy...and well worth the wait! Not only do they serve deliciously prepared food, they always do it with such warm and friendly service! It's the kind of place you end up leaving with a smile. Eddy, one of the cashiers is pretty much the best at guiding new customers through the menu and suggestions & just great, attentive, & caring overall. Always keeps me coming back!

FVaCwN0F6dBKLJ-GJB-i-Q.text: Horrible customer service.    So we went to this location after having known about it for years.  It was finally on Groupon (or so that is what Groupon says).    We went to check it out with the Groupon for 30% off cash back.  Food is good, but pricey.  I log on to see that I got my cash back.  It doesn't show.  So a few weeks later, I've double verified that I have it all signed up correctly. We go in today and I ask if I need to let him know I've got the cash back Groupon signed up.  He says "oh, that is the valle verde location and not us".  He says this right away.  Well aware and this Groupon has been on for months.  So I say the Groupon doesn't say one location only and everyone knows that Groupons do specify a single location.  He says he can get the manager.  I say ok.  The manager comes and say "nope, not this location and it is for valle verde only".  Has nothing to do with us.  However, he could have a sign, he could call headquarters or Groupon and he is well aware of this False advertising and that he is getting customers who assume they will receive their rebate, taking their business in silence and out right knowing people will order anyway once they have came in under False pretenses.   I told him that this was my second time coming in for the promo, I lived around the corner and would be a potential regular customer....I watch a lot of football!   Wings are needed.  Lol.  He just says, sorry and that is that.   I said that if he didn't honor the promo, I was leaving without ordering.  So we left.  I do not like False or deceitful businesses.  Everyone in the store was well aware of the promo and that they were not honoring it.   Groupons do have Specific store only addresses.  He is well aware that he is intentionally having people come for the promo and then not honoring it or letting people know he is not honoring it.    Btw, u.s. halal chicken is a block away and great food and great service and wonderful staff who appreciate your business and go above and beyond.  Please go there and leave these unethical "business" owners to their own kind.  I appreciate people that don't use deceptive practices as business models.

Br8mh6y9-uCdt4KxmNg_CA.text: It's really, really good. And it's consistently good. I've been here no less than 10 times over the past year, and my orders are always done within a few minutes.  The chicken is seasoned and juicy. You get to choose your flavor of sauce. The portions are generous. I always am given an extra tender and tons of fries.   I can't believe I've been going to Canes all this time.  In-restaurant dining can get crowded. They don't have a lot of space to meet the demand. Tables are full of paper towels which is much better than napkins. Drinks are small.

IcpKCCX-rNLO-9cBQ1gegw.text: I don't write many reviews but when I do I write it about great service and awesome food like here at da shack. The food here is awesome the coating on the chicken is delicious and the fingers are perfectly moist inside the shoestring fries taste great and there is plenty of sauce options. They have draft beer and it is dirt cheap. Now for the service I have to say Eddie was one of the best employees at a restaurant that I have ever had service from he greeted me helped with the menu options was helpful and courteous the whole time five star service.

0noUQ8F2XWge54UrJjTAwA.text: Chicken Shack is the best! We've been eating here for years. Eddie helped us and was very polite, accommodating and friendly. Glad to see them opening new locations but  still keeping up customer service at   all of the older locations.

IbaKcn_k4LI4QZ9Y_jysHg.text: The lemon pepper wings here are the best I've had. I enjoy yard bird and in size and flavor these wings meet my expectations. This location is always busy whenever I'm there, a testament to good food.

wnQR6btAjIzd7453tsdPTw.text: My boyfriend and I come here every once in a while for chicken tenders. We would come here everyday but unfortunately it's across town from us but when we are on this side of town we come here. Well this visit was different because I ordered chicken wings instead of chicken tenders! Their chicken wings were a game changer. I will never order anything else but their chicken wings. They are so damn good like you can't go to any other fried chicken ever again because they are that good! They are buttermilk battered and fried just like the tenders. But they seriously taste like miniature fried chicken! Omg.... Drool. I've literally been trying to find a fried chicken place and now I can finally stop looking. Chicken Shack won. They won all the awards. I don't care what anyone says. Man like after I finished my meal I wished I had another basket of wings...  Another thing though, their service was spot on seriously. We went in there at peak lunch time. People clocked out for lunch and headed over here. The line was basically out the door. But they were so fast and efficient it was amazing to watch them work. We literally ordered, got our drinks, haven't even sat down for a minute and our food was already ready. Talk about fast food. And that was literally everyone's orders too. They barely sat down and their food was already done. It was piping hot and their portions are always generous. They always give you extra. My boyfriend ordered a 3 finger combo and they gave him 2 extra tenders. He almost mad that he got extra tenders because he couldn't eat it all haha. Chicken shack is always the best choice for chicken tenders and wings.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Life changing chicken wings.

aoomEYmrnhs5BQC5TXDKtQ.text: Our favorite place we went while in Nevada! Get a lot of food for what you pay, and the fries are the best I've EVER had! Service was great too. Cashier was very helpful as it was our first time visiting. Would definitely go back!

vyowbqE0c7XW83MfiDnabQ.text: I don't like sauces normally, but I like their sauces. Really fresh chicken, though it seems like they don't season the batter at all because they rely on the sauces for flavor.   Try the cajun with fresh parm!

ZF58WSgZ8idpJTTW6J8pSA.text: I should have been smarter then to be fooled by the TV ad for this place.  There is a reason I have driven BY this place for years without stopping.    The young lady who took my order had the charm of a wet mop.  There was no greeting, just a "what do you want".  When I said I needed a second to decide, I got an obvious eye-roll, and a slump in her posture.   There was no one behind me in line, but I felt like I was bothering her just by being there.    I had chicken fingers with fries, and a small cup of macaroni salad.  One should be aware going in that EVERYTHING is ala cart.  U don't even get one dipping sauce for the overpriced fingers without paying extra.  Speaking of the chicken fingers ... definitely one of the worst I've ever had.  They were very tough and stringy.  The crust was plain-ass flour!  I don't think the chicken or the breading had ever SEEN any seasoning.  Bland, bland, bland!  That, on top of the chewy chicken made them a ZERO star item for me. The macaroni salad, while WAY overpriced, was pretty descent.  At $2.50 for about 1/2 cup, it should have been good! The tiny cup of honey mustard dipping sauce (which was a 50 charge) tasted just like the Kraft dressing of the same flavor. The only thing that was actually good was the order of fries.  ($2.50 for a small).  They were the shoestring type, which I prefer.  They are about one and a half of the 2 stars I gave the place. Would I return?  Only if I was VERY hungry, and everything else was closed.

LQgdvQWtjrEh1WrphSdcgw.text: This place is good my boyfriend comes here very often & couldn't wait till I try it. I would say it's good but maybe a little overrated. I'll probably come back my boyfriend request not mine.

Xo7r-R-qNV4pyvQ8_WGTGQ.text: We were missing our favorite chicken fingers from Old Chicago restaurant back in Colorado. We truly hit the jackpot with The Chicken Shack. The chicken tenders here are huge, and very tasty. I just wish there was more room to sit and eat. All tables were full. But when every table is taken, you have to know this place rocks!

RfOPWdnzP09dR1q7q8M_UQ.text: Ate here Once fell in love.It was finger licking good,I would go there at least twice a week or more, if you really like eating Chicken Wings.

riJUJJPKn6EegvH-HwvvMw.text: We ordered the Shack Pack with the 20 fingers to go.  The place is small with some inside and outside seating.  We didn't have any trouble finding a table right away.   It was good but my favorite was their baked beans!

eTKHIxlhcXDX-daZje7Vpg.text: The place is called chicken shack... so they should have amazing finger-licking good chicken right? Meh. I left a little disappointed. I ordered the chicken strips which I found were overly dry. The strips were large with a lot of meat to them and not too much breading which I liked, however the pieces were just too dry overall.   I will give it to them that they have every dipping sauce you can think of and then some. So I liked the choices there. And extra points because their French fries are awesome! Thin and crispy and perfect to munch on.

KUVV9rzimxST9aTugrj2bQ.text: Great food, great service......experience was ruined by loud music playing overhead. The sauces are great too......I like the variety.

2__I-qGDZGZOO7p4l0Ny-g.text: I used to work at Sunset Park for Clark County. So, I've been to the chicken "shack" since it was Chicken Bonz.  The blonde lady who runs the register has been there since I remember. She really didn't smile, or seem to have any personality at all. I remember ordering chicken tenders in habenero honey to go, with fries. The meal that I got was six pieces of chicken, and included a drink. Somehow, this ends up close to $11.  $11...? That's like charging me a dollar for every piece of chicken. Then charging $2 for a handful of fries, and then $2 for a drink, plus tax. I just think that's a little steep.  I get home, and I didn't have tenders, I had wings...and they are wimpyyyyyy!!!  The sauce was good, and so were the fries. I just think that the prices are steep, and the feeling of the store isn't very welcoming.

XoXig0nrar4nI-fRM9uFKA.text: The chicken fingers and shoestring fries are really good. Some of the best in Las Vegas. I love how they have a large selection of sauces! I love trying different sauces. I recommend you try the Sweet Chili.

vCgo74cj_ENwW6-sM1NNNQ.text: Had some honey BBQ chicken fingers and fries. They were a bit over cooked which made them very dry. The fries here are good but fries alone are not going to make me return.

GFtAnhDCSpLglW9FfHeL4Q.text: The service was quick and the chicken was crispy and juicy and not too oily. Their serving sizes are good and filling. Their sauces weren't as good as good as canes' and you can get more from canes for the same price, but if I were in the area I'd go there again

MFq94KPN1L80YG6eNDLweQ.text: Really the best chicken southeast.   The husband and son go here every chance they have. The chicken fingers are big and juicy and the wings are amazing.  A small order of fries is huge and they are crisp and fresh.   Prices are very reasonable.   The restaurant is a hole in the wall but conveniently located by smith's.   They would have gotten 5 stars if it was a little cleaner.   Staff is friendly and helpful and food comes up fast.

eW3LDQtsyYnPA_-RuNZ6_A.text: This place is "A-OK" as the 3 star rating indicates.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it's a better alternative than, say, gnawing my own arm off.  The shoestring fries would be very tasty, but they were so covered in salt that I couldn't eat more than a couple.  It must've been a heavy-handed day in the kitchen based on everyone's otherwise rave reviews.  I had chicken fingers and they were tasty.  The breading was good and they were cooked well.  The ranch was runny, but yummy.  It's expensive for what you get, but not highway robbery.  Also, the woman at the counter needs to relax a bit.  Honey, you're not running a Fortune 500 company.  It's the Chicken Shack.  Take a chill pill sister.

dHmhE_d7JmXt_xrd7_Hu1w.text: Made an order to go by phone and an employee with a blonde bleached Mohawk said and I quote "We're f-ing closed" as I walked in to pick up. I ignored him and walked up to the counter and paid. Then a family with a small child walked in (keep in mind that the sign still said open and it was 8:38 when they closed at 9:00) and he was so rude that they left. Not even sure what else to say.

6wbLoYx-4oB1NkGR8cPUMQ.text: The food was good and came out quicker then expected. A must try if your a local or visitor.

0jQcJXbyvdUYMWQOh2N2cQ.text: This place stands the test of time! I have been eating Chicken Shack since it was called "Chicken Bonz" and the food is always great. It's hip, and truly a local jewel!   I think the only thing about this place is a quote on the wall about immigrants that seems very offensive... But other than that this place is cool.

CsWhXmIwEHTV-7NeWQZDGw.text: I've gotten Chicken Shack 3 times. The first 2 times were around lunch time, and I thought the food was amazing (I've only had the fingers and wings so far.) I LOVED the fries. The third time I went there was a Friday afternoon, and everything had less flavor, even the sauce. The fries were really soggy and seemed like they were undercooked as well.  I'll try again, though, and hopefully that one Friday was just a fluke.

J4d5F2oXN1CS0g9ixGM5mA.text: Best chicken fingers ever! I absolutely love this place. The price is right for the amount of goodness you get. What makes this place different from the rest is definitely the SAUCE. The sauce is definitely the boss over here. Bar none. The fries are good, but not the best. Dip the fries in the sauce, then they turn into the best fries ever. Service is always friendly and top-notch. My favorite spot in Henderson.  I love the Jamaican Jerk, Spicy Teriyaki, and Hot Buffalo. They also have dry rub seasoning too.

VAg6vwBlc1KM9cPrstV4pQ.text: You instantly get the warmth of a small business as soon as you enter. The lady at the register treated each person like a distinguished guess (mom in the back was even nice). The menu is simple but the sauces are packed with all kinds of awesomeness. I went with the plain wings with hot teriyaki and sweet chili on the side. The fries were shoestring cut, fried to perfection, and flavored with fun.   I really dig this place and cant wait to go back. I NEED MORE SAUCE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. It&#39;s the chicken shack

UacnR0h33Yj7DGvQTO7KVA.text: This is the only restaurant my picky teenagers will eat chicken from. The chicken is always fresh, never dry, and breading is just enough.  Fries keep well-you can even freeze leftover fries.  They heat up nicely. We never have any chicken left over, but I'm sure it reheats well.   You MUST ask for extra fry sauce, though-that stuff is like crack. Dip everything in it!!

HoFDbwTOXXEJX7mzP2emmA.text: Amazing chicken! Our favorite spot for chicken literially every Sunday after church! We bring everyone there! But recently the customer service hasn't been very pleasant. The 2 new cashiers that we encountered the past 2 months have been very rude & aggrivated with their job. The back of the house guys are always good to us and personable. We recently missed a Sunday there bc of their service. We hope that it'll change soon or they will lose us.

t77DEj9xmhS-quTBtIcwdA.text: Great wings and a huge selection of sauces that are amazing. Little bit tight for inside seating though.

m1yVmb-SIv34hghCYwUjqg.text: Took a bit of a drive to visit Chicken Shack and I am glad I did.  I walked in and looked at the menu and thought to myself that I could put down a 5 piece chicken fingers easy so I better get some wings to back them up. The portions here are huge and they also have the best fingers I've had in town so far. I was delighted. I love Fried Chicken so much that I drive to L.A. just to eat at Roscoe's, The Chicken Lady, and KyoChon. I am happy this place is here because I would have to drive to L.A. for it too.  Thank you Jaime W. for letting me in on your little secret. I'm hooked, I need to come back here again.

We didn't try any of the sauces this time but I'm sure we will be back and we'll give them a try then. The dining room is small and can get loud, but everything was clean.

HAqvsESvvBJGSFbBRKdvlA.text: Sorry Yelp fam it's been 2 weeks since I've been to check this place out and here is what I think. The service there/here is very friendly and they take really good care of you. If you want to know where all your cox workers are well come have lunch and you will see lol. We arrived about 11:00-11:30 and it wasn't packed just a few ppl but in 30 minutes this places filled up and it was a Saturday. Ok ok let's rate the food the chicken was ok nothing I was in awe about it satisfies your craving though if you're having one. I will be back I think maybe I didn't order right maybe I will try a different flavor. The fries were yummy but what I loved best was the bacon cheese burger we order.....go figure right but it was hella good! Well that's all I have for now but the experience and food were good you should go check them out

VWyn0f4SIt4-mrOT_O_zIg.text: I have been going to Chicken Shack for 2 years and I love it. The chicken is so fresh and delicious. The workers are always kind. Go to Chicken Shack, it'll change your life

zphIRN-Qxyydojk-4D1ACA.text: I am just going to say that this is the Best Chicken wing spot i have ever ate at. We have had both the tenders and the Wings. I did have a burger here and I will say it was quite dry. But its not a burger place. I go to this spot a lot. It is on way to work, I order on way stop in and head back out to work. Once they get to know you it is like family when you go in here. (customer service is job one here. the parking lot has been under construction due to smith's new gas station so it has been a bit inconvenient getting in and out. They are always busy so that is a good sign. Chicken, Josie likes the Garlic Parmesan I am a fan of the regular wings. If you order in they have beer on tap as well. This Chicken is so crunchy and juicy. Big wings with a ton of meat. You can also order sauces to go with you. I like that they offer blue cheese as well as ranch.  I go back again and again. You need to try this place. I believe they have other locations, however I have only been here. They know me by name so what's not to like.

0BKFuSMhJON7q_FlrQnppQ.text: Fantastic food and flavors! Excellent sercive! Great friendly  atmosphere. Great music!  All around awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

zZ3ekp7-kruo2PCLjqzXcQ.text: Very good tenders! I can only express this rating and review on the tenders and sweet chili sauce. Both were just right. The tenders are white meat and no gristle or unwanted "parts." The breading is light enough that it doesn't fall off and crispy enough that it's not a chore to eat. I think it was seasoned well too. The sweet chili dipping sauce had just the right amount of heat and not overly sweet or gelatinous in texture, like some "sweet/sour" sauces can be. For takeout during a lunch rush, the wait was less than 10 minutes for an order of tenders. Also a plus, will be back!!

j7ofCJ9c4q-cOJHYUhLbxg.text: Meh, it will do. I have tried this place twice, cause of the hype & I wings. The prices are average as far as wings go. The wings are pretty good size, with lots of meat. I have tried the hot BBQ and just regular buffalo wing sauce both were OK. Upon my 2nd visit I politely asked what sauce they recommend, the lady taking my order was kind of a bit## , she just said," the sauces are on the menu" in a snide way. The fries seemed pretty good but mine were doused in salt. What's kinda bs is they charge you for ranch or any sauce. That's like ordering nachos and paying extra for cheese, also there's no celery to bite into when your mouth is burning. All that aside, I didn't think this place was anything special. I will probably try it again if there is a spectacular sauce someone can reccomend and I have better customer service.

JapfM1fDT8RgoZEb-ZP_ng.text: I thought the comments "chicken on steroids" and "unusually plump" were funny,,,, and yet True!  It is plump n tender, batter can be a bit more separated but overall a good chicken strip.  Habanero honey sauce is tasty, tried a few other sauces but they were ehhhh... U gotta find your own sauce! Cole slaw was a bit below KFC level, a bit soggy and minced, they do have $1 drafts! (12oz) For 5.95 you get 3 strips, fries n soda, not a bad deal...   And free chicken quotes on the walls....

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. L
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken quotes

_mqsIlM8JFP_QatGgTDbdw.text: This place is the business! Their chicken is always hot, fresh and above all crispy. Not to mention their array of tasty sauces to smother your chicken in, but you can also get sauce on the side for you dippers. Not a huge fan of the shoe-string fry. I like my potatoes like how I like my women, with a little more meat on them ya feel. The frys weren't bad by any means though. They also have burgers which I haven't got around to will definitely be back to try though!

bAq0AkvAevX0b84VMDXK8Q.text: Great service and nothing beats an air conditioned quaint place.   The bf and I had a "half & half" of 3 wings and 3 fingers with shoestring fries.  Tried : Honey bbq, hot teriyaki, garlic parmesean, and lemon pepper. Gotta say the lemon pepper was my favorite since there was this kick to it at the end.   Ended up eating just one of each because we were curing a hangover...  Their sweet tea is excellent!   Brought it home for dinner and dipped it into spinach dip which was surprisingly good.   Will definitely go back again

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummmmmmm

Bb14rz1tDV-ed293Orw6rQ.text: Avoid this place.  I've definitely had better. I was looking forward to this place, and it was a complete let-down. Yelp led me astray for the first time. So astray that I feel inspired to leave my two-cents.   The fries were soggy. I like a fry with a good bit of crisp, but without too much crunch where it is overcooked. These fries must have been sitting around for a long time. The chicken was terrible. For a place being named for their chicken and still being open, I'm surprised it lasted this long. The chicken fingers were just as soggy, the breading fell apart, and there was no seasoning. I can't believe I spent money on this.  The only thing this place has going for it are the jokes on the walls and its variety of amazing sauces, which had some kick!  You're better off with Raising Cane's. It's cheaper and better quality.

hN9mbr1bfomPPpnINs9S-w.text: I love eating at Chicken Shack! They provide generous portions, and the chicken fingers are to die for! They also serve beer to wash down all that delicious unhealthiness! The only deterrence is all the construction happening on Sunset Road. All that construction and lane closures is a joke!!!

D8bxmU48WPE2KoDR9nsNQA.text: I feel so morbidly obese for loving Chicken Shack's chicken tenders so much, but I dream about this place when I am back in Los Angeles, the land of many delicacies. I really don't have another chicken restaurant to compare this to since I've never been to Raising Cane's due to the distance, but this place is mouthgasmic enough for me. Chicken Shack is just minutes away from my house, it's cheap, and service is fast, which makes this place a great choice for poor medical students like myself.  The tenders are deep-fried to a crisp, moist, and comes piping hot either drenched in a sauce of your choice or on the side if you so please.  You can also ask for a side of ranch to cool that palette if the sauce is too spicy. The fries taste fresh and definitely beats any fast food chain.   I'd come here every week if I wasn't worried about growing another chin or fucking up my arteries...but alas, I'll limit my attendance to every few months because my hyperactive thyroid is now slowing down and soon, i will have to eat just lettuce to stay alive.

ymRXgbDLY97TnMV0HXfDtw.text: As an avid chicken tender fan,  my boyfriend and I are always looking for the next best chicken tenders.   We decided to give this place a try,  and I will say I am presently impressed.   The place it's self is kind of a hole in the wall,  the decor consists of 'why did the chicken cross the road" jokes,  and license places on the walls from various states it's self.    Service is very fast,  and friendly.   We both decided to order the five piece chicken tender meal considering of five tenders  some fries and a drink.   I was pleased to see that they had am array of different seasonings and sauces to go with your chicken. Including chilli,  hot,  mild,   lemon pepper,  and sweet garlic.  I decided to get lemon pepper seasoning,  and a side of honey mustard.  The chicken it's self it nice,  crispy,  and juicy... Magically everything you could possibly want in a chicken tender.  Unlike canes,  I actually really enjoyed their skinny fries that came with the meal.    I was an avid canes lover.... Now it looks like im more of a chicken shack fan.   All and all I'm very impressed with the food,  and service,  and will be coming back soon.

fBbsrv4xu4MFAlFeLQjCYQ.text: I used to come by when this placed was called Chicken Bonz and the name had always fascinated me. So I decided to stop by with a couple friends and we were not disappointed.  The place definitely has that mom and pop feel to it. The walls are decorated by license plates and 'why did the chicken cross the road' jokes. They even have a couple of arcade machines if you get bored. The menu is pretty standard for a chicken place. They have wings, fingers, fries along with several sauces. They also had a burger, coleslaw, and some other stuff but I mean c'mon who gets the cheese burger and the chicken finger restaurant?  The fingers were great, juicy and moist and good size. The shoestrings fries were just like the ones you would find at other restaurants but a good addition to the meal. I had mine tossed in the hot bqq which had a perfect combo of spicyness and bbq flavor. The honey bbq and the lemon pepper are also great.   While I thought the food was great I did notice that the service was pretty slow. I understand they really focus on fresh food, but it should not take 25 minutes to get chicken fingers out. It's a fast food restaurant and even some sit-down places are quicker than that. I also think its a bit pricey for chicken fingers, a 5 finger combo is close to $10bux. Still def worth checking out if your into chicken.

n3UaghdU01L1lzmMnwE2uA.text: Decent at best, the breading was soft and so were the fries, the whole meal seemed a little oily compared to the Chicken Shack  in Boulder  The Chicken Shack in Boulder is way better, they make a crisper, less oily chicken finger and crisp well done fries. Also Raising Canes on Las Vegas BLVD is better.

RHZotSoYH7P2Up2sbAfy9A.text: Despite driving by this place more times than I can count I didn't even know this place existed. At my last Yelp event Bethany E. was telling me about this spot and how great it was. Once it was brought to my attention I finally noticed it while driving by. So, Saturday comes around and my husband and I doing the thing where we run through 50 options before picking a lunch spot.  My husband remembered that we wanted to try this spot and we knew it had to be done.  This spot was busy on a Saturday afternoon which was a good sign. We decided to get our order to go and it didn't take long for it to be prepared. The guy at the counter was friendly. The prices are great as well.  I really liked the chicken fingers. There is plenty of white meat and the breading is really good. The breading was light and seemed like it was made fresh for our order, not kept in a heater until served. The French fries were really good. The large order was way too many fries, a small would have been enough for two to share. I'd been craving macaroni salad and this macaroni salad really hit the spot. I loved it. The sauce options are crazy. There are so many. We ordered about six because we couldn't decide. My favorite was the Honey BBQ with the Sweet Chili coming in second.   Great food and great prices. This spot definitely beats the chicken chain that is completely overrated.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. So many sauce options!
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

I-XN01aB_sr73OIcEcMcqg.text: I don't eat all meats. Only seafood. I'm a pescatarian but my daughter wanted chicken shack. My son already frequents it and LOVES it. Just a great hangout atmosphere. I was pleasantly surprised when the cashier stopped me from ordering baked beans bc they have chunks of pork in them. I had only briefly mentioned my not eating meat in conversation to my daughter. I thought that was really nice she noticed and talk about attentive! She made me feel my preferences matter in just noticing that one thing. I ordered a large fry and had no idea it would be so huge. Great value. I love that they're thin. Added a side of ranch and blue cheese. Seemed to be ample sauce. The mustard potato salad was truly southern and tasted homemade possibly. My tea was good, I mixed it with lemonade. Everyone in our group totalling two tables were happy. My daughter loved her tenders and my friend loved her wings. I didn't have to ask my son and his friends. No brainer. Great visit.

gm7VL_XZ0wUT7PmjVfBZkQ.text: Very under impressed and definitely will never be coming back here again the coleslaw tasted like absolute cried. And the chicken was undercooked and over fried, if that can never be achieved

Z6qob8u1dntUVKx5mSaeig.text: Love this place. Its been a while since I had come in with my sister who brought me to this fine gem. The owners are very sweet, and food is great, Customer Service is always on point.

XLr1ladf0PFzo14AJ2u1pw.text: Only place I love getting wings and tenders. I get the dry rub garlic Parmesan for wings and the Jamaican jerk on the tenders. The customer service is always bomb af. Never been disappointed!

f_dvEfw39IssDBwKbrp1eQ.text: The best wings I had in so far I've one had the lemon pepper and it was off the chain. The chicken was fresh and hot.

p6TLjKD-eMYxufazbj7oEQ.text: Great service and attitude. Always love a warm welcome when about to eat delicious food!

7sj6VbAlNbXrX2gXWx9GFA.text: Great chicken great fries. A lot of cool sauces to choose from. The stag was cool and helpful for being a first timer to the place. Would recommend

ttDZy26Lrk8aF8mT6RennQ.text: Awesome spot! They've made the best of the decor, but it's a self-proclaimed snack. Please don't go in expecting Canes decor. The customer service was excellent. Chicken was unique and absolute perfection! They have soooo many different dry rubs and sauces. The fries too.... to die for. I will be back!!

mcPaZTgq2FN5gAQlyvBIVA.text: I'm looking forward to going back to this restaurant on this trip to Vegas. It was so good and affordable last time I had it a cookie years ago.

aJimCKiwUT2mKZN_BcVV9w.text: After a small lunch at Hot Dog Heaven in Henderson,  I was ravenous come dinner time. After reading the great reviews of the Chicken Shack I knew my hunger Blues were about to end.  This small restaurant was jammed with people which is always a good sign. I got the 5 piece Chicken Fingers with fries. Calling them fingers is misleading as they are very big cuts of breast meat that are expertly coated and fried to perfection. The seasoning on the chicken was a letdown as it was way too salty. The sauces are all house made and my Honey Garlic helped out my salty chicken quite a bit.  Overall a decent meal that is close to being great once they get the seasoning down.
