2eTjOi_MQh2oT9xI1gQBmw.text: The did have shoestring fries and fry sauce...  and Alaskan Amber beer... all great starts... but at the end of the day the wings were at best average... I asked for Jamaican jerk on the side... they came out soaked in it... to their credit, they did bring me 6 more plain for free... Onto my next quest!!!

Z4o4muLvXPHIIUVa-_oOzw.text: Loved this place!  Today Friday 30 2:00 pm the cashier that took our order was just the nicest person I've ever met.  Fingers, wings and fries were just BOMB'  I'm giving a "I'll come back"  Price isn't bad at all.. paid $11 for my order and my boyfriend and I were able to both eat from the same plate!   Omg, I'm just so happy we've found this place!  Even better than Buffalo Wild Wings.   Xoxo

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

1nBaGtmZCId3rrV7VN-Log.text: Alrighty, although there were a few minor issues I have to say this is my new favorite wing spot. I walked in and was greeted by a cool cashier chick with tats and a hat. She led me to order the #1 which was 6 wings (I chose 3 medium and 3 garlic parm), fries and a drink for around ten bucks and within 10 minutes they were yelling my name that my order was ready.  The wings are large and meaty for the record but when I bit into my first medium wing it was an odd feeling of wonderful flavor mixed with disappointment that it wasn't as hot in the inside as it was on the outside. My next wing was garlic Parmesan (plain wing with some powdered Parmesan) and that bad boy was nice and hot on the inside.....idk why, but they were oddly different temperatures. The fries were whatever, there were a ton of them but they weren't anything special. The ranch was fine too but I'm a dipper and I should have asked for two.  I could almost live on those medium wings (next time I'll try a few lemon pepper) but I won't be ordering the boring garlic Parmesan again and depending on the occasion I'll probably just go for wings without fries. Lastly, there is only one small bathroom and it wasn't a dump just a little dusty here and there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

3bb9mfjOMaJbCahnOFeK0w.text: Well my first time at the chicken shack SUCKED not due to taste, however, due to the fact that The CHICKEN Shack was out of CHICKEN FINGERS. How could their staff allow for this to happen? Use a better inventory system

wDdThW4NI7KHFjrVbIUn6w.text: I just love this place! Best chicken fingers, fries,  and sauces. They're very consistent and always cook everything perfectly.

IRVAVsoaKo0VVrFrGCZ3gA.text: The fried chicken is cheap.  That's the attraction and why this place is busy, even at ten in the morning. It's better than the fast food places for sure.   Latest visit the place already looked trashed, sticky floors, the floors around soda dispenser area was wet.  Come on, they just opened? I was hesitant on ordering chicken because if front of house is a hot mess what about the kitchen? Went against my better judgment and ordered my combo meal from the surly cashier.  Well now I remember why we don't come here so often.  Some pieces were good, some salty, most pieces dry.  Ended up with upset stomach even though I ended throwing most of my meal. Sigh.  So this update is more a note to myself why we pass on this place.

34oaDP27Q7k5rcCdopYcPg.text: I can't believe I've never reviewed this place. Chicken shack is my spot! I love hot wings but I love lightly breaded plain chicken wings with sauce on the side better!  Chicken shack serves wings, tenders, chili, beer, and crack fries. Their wings and tenders are lightly floured and are also huge. I always get the wing, fingers, fries, and soda combo. I think it's a #4. It comes with 3 wings 3 fingers, their shoe stringish fries, and a soda. I believe this combo is $8.95. It is A LOT of food. Last night the guy even gave me an extra wing AND finger. Kudos! I ended up taking four pieces of chicken home.  For flavor recommendations I suggest the lemon pepper or garlic parm POWDER flavoring or the hot sauce. The hot sauce had the perfect amount of heat with a slight sweet note that I adore.  I love my sauce on the side when I eat chicken wings and imagine having these breaded wings thrown into sauces would be too much.  They get REALLY busy, but the food comes out quickly. I think for the freshness and taste that the prices are fair as they do give you a lot of food. My only gripe is that you might have to clean the table you want on your own as the turn around is quick and there isn't always someone to wipe it down.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. 3 wing, 3 tender combo.

21CHQ4Oy5fkZrt4W6U6tzA.text: Go for the chicken..but do try the FRIED CHICKEN SALAD.  Simple, but delicious.  They are generous with the chicken.   and their ranch is very good.

wewD6srMwcZPP02oCK8_0Q.text: First I went in to grab a menu, the gentleman who greeted me was wearing a lakers beanie and was very polite and helpful. I had never heard of the place so I wanted to investigate. After some deliberation, I decided to go back in and order. Again, the lakers beanie guy was there and asked what I wanted. I ordered a 5 piece but changed to a 10 piece. At this point, the computer was giving him some trouble so he asked a lady to come help. She was wearing a baseball cap. While she was fixing the order I asked her a couple questions about the sauces and what type of sauce went on the hot wings and such, to my surprise she replied rather rudely. I had never been to the restaurant before so I figured they were reasonable questions but to her it seemed like I was really interfering with her daily routine. Other than the rudeness from the baseball cap wearing female, I felt goods about this place. The chicken strips were great. I got 5 in medium sauce and 5 plain along with a ranch and spicy ranch. The 5 tossed in the sauce were better overall bur if if you want plain strips i wouldn't hesitate. Also, there are some funny quotes on the wall. I look forward to going back and trying some of the other items on the menu.

uToZ71OOnqzBpSrjCoIXzA.text: First time ever at this place and i love chicken so i lovebthis place gokd food will be back soon just doen the street from me

KlfvIWJ1rx8WGs0U9q87LA.text: One of my new favorite spots , the service , the food , and especially the ranch were perfected ! I couldn't ask for more !  Keep doin what your doin

iPZ-k0ZMYcM4ZFPgm3FiMQ.text: My family and I had dinner with Jaime W. and Shirley B. It was quite lovely. I got what most people would get. Chicken fingers and fries. The fries were da bomb diggity. Dip them in ranch, perfection. I would want to be buried in these. The fingers were decent as well. Dip them in ranch as well, they will be tons better. (I am in an open relationship with ranch.) It was pretty grimy there though. Doesn't see like they clean the tables. You sit, you clean up your mess, with the exception of a few crumbs and papers. You order at the desk, so the staff probably doesn't see the nastiness of their tables, other than a quick glance when they bring your food. It was sticky. You can get over it once you eat though. Just wash your hands after and you'll be as fresh as a daisy.

GvAaMD1Mj-c7ejp2Xg9K6Q.text: my foodie "uncle" recommended me here. I like it a lot. many sauce choices. fries are crunchy, wings and fingers are juicy and crunchy. just the way I like it. opens at 10. I came in before 11 and it's full of customers.

IA28ZHvK_NY29vTEyNVz3Q.text: Great fast friendly service.  The chicken is amazing. Super fresh and tasty.  I had the medium wings "flats are the best" with the Parmesan garlic sprinkled on them.  Absolutely delicious.  Also got to try the fingers with sweet and sour sauce and hot BBQ.  Also wonderful. I'm not usually a big fan of white meat. But these fingers were so juicy and tender I couldn't help but to devour them.  Fries. Don't get me started.  The shoestring fries are fantastic. I recommend having them with tons of pepper.  They were great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Fingers are delicious!!!

Ce3Xzxhiri4npBhFY0ZP5w.text: Love this place!! Nice size wings, shoestring fries, choice of different sauces, they give you the option to have them prepared with or sauce on the side. Never disappointed when I go, sometimes the line can be long.

nEA0_00Wu6dZbFwTcBOC8g.text: Love this place! I've been coming here since they first opened and haven't been disappointed yet. The owners are always friendly and inviting no matter how busy the place is. Whenever I'm in this side of town it is my go to stop.

fAIsxH_6SL-B-9bNEhY55Q.text: My family used to go there a lot. We generally got decent food for what it was. Recently bought dinner and it was disgusting. It was soggy, under sauced, and tasted old and terrible. We called to let them know that night. They on their own offered to replace it, but the next day when we called in asking if we can pick up our replacement, they were very rude. Acting like we were trying to steal food, when they were the ones who offered. They talked back to us..argued with us, just all around acted terrible. They finally said they'd replace a small portion of the terrible old chicken they sold us. We said never mind.  My sister didn't think the food would be safe for her kids, that they might do something to it, because the people acted so underhanded and trashy. I wouldn't have guessed, from having gone in there that they would be so low.   If you like this restaurant, I'd go to a different location!

wv8jBCyldzU81y-L7Et6Ow.text: This is a little hole in the wall place in a Smiths parking lot. I would've normally just overlooked it if a friend hasn't give me a gift card.   Chicken Shack does chicken justice. I had some of the best chicken strips I've ever tasted. Their grilled chicken sandwich was similarly tasty. The choices of sauce are add nice variety and flavor. Further, the portions are generous.  However, the Chicken Shack's strength is also the major weakness. The focus is on chicken such that there aren't many non-chicken selections. There is salad and burgers, but it seems to defeat the purpose of going to a chicken specialty restaurant.  Take home point: if you're craving delicious chicken, this is a good place to satisfy that hunger.

rhRGFqYQP6BGYlTUDJMANw.text: Worst customer service I have ever experience arrival at 8:40 and the guy says they are close. How do you run a business that close at 9:pm and say you close at 8:30 pm  every day poor business etiquette if take you 30 mins to clean then make your hours that you stay at work to close 9:30 I travel far to try this but I will come back you can keep it

UJWNn7JOVLSUFSDCpZBQcw.text: Some of the best chicken fingers in town . The dipping sauces are amazing . Mom and pop style fast food that is excellent.

PrKJii8wzvYSyqZtighiRQ.text: This place is great I give it five stars total. Its a small place its always full and that means hot food. Nope you wont get any cold food here. They have wings, strips and fries. They have strong good soda pop with a extra clean soda pop machine. Rather you eat it inside or take it home you will be hooked on they chicken. They have cool quotes on the wall about chickens. This place is also not over priced so it wont kill your budget if your like me and your on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken

wTFrFGXSy0Dg-9i0XZbWVg.text: This review is purely based off of the fact I just made a large order for my office and got nothing but attitude from the woman taking my order. My office orders lunch on several occasions from small local businesses like this one and I have never witnessed someone be so annoyed that we haven't finished our large order yet. The state that broke the camels back was our final co-workers order was preceded with the exclaimed comment of "oh my gosh ok, is that the last one". Prior to that, a side note during our order was that if we have a large order, to call ahead of time. Believe me when I say that if I didn't work for a busy office and that the last thing we had to think about two hours before lunch was what and where we were going to eat, we would have. We got to our order for a burger, where she then continued to largely exhale and tell us how small her grill was (we had 45 pieces of grilled chicken on it already and she told us it would take at least 30 minutes) and that now it would take even longer. As if being there and ordering food for at least 10 people wasn't bad enough, we sure as hell weren't going to waste anybody else's time by cancelling a burger order because you warned us of how inadequate your cooking equipment was. I'm sure I could continue with every eye roll and every interruption during our order from this woman, but to make matters worse, yes - I was standing there so long that my sandals were stuck to their disgustingly sticky floor and I could have potentially cracked my ankle. I hope they're glad that I do NOT recommend anyone bragging to a group of people to eat here or else you'll be greeted with frustration. This experience lacked enjoy ability as much for us as I'm sure for her.

The size of their wings are so massive that it beats out all the other chicken spots I've tried.  Yes they're full of flavor, too! DY4VLZQj-5CYRpXE0GM7UA.text: A must try for every fried chicken lover. Generous portion, crunchy/tender delicious chicken, and an amazing sauce selection. Try the fry, "damn" hot, and spicy ranch sauces. Fries are crispy and salty scrumptious.

AJJpP_fFd6VG8W9NErNsOg.text: The Chicken Shack, not to be mistaken for Chicken Bonz. Although almost everything taste the same.  You may think 6 wings, fries, ranch and a drink for $9.12 is pricey, think again. These wings are huge and they give a generous amount of fries.  I recommend getting the 3 fingers and 3 wings combo, way worth it, the fingers are huge pieces of juicy breast meat.  They also have an AYCE special going on all day everyday for $11.95 ($1 dollar cheaper than chicken bonz).  I still have yet to try it.  They also have $1 drafts!  As for the inside, it's small and it's maintained pretty well, they got two TV's hanging on the wall, two arcade machines and limited seating on the inside, but there's a couple tables on the outside too.  Overall, flavor and quantity is what Chicken Shack has.  That's really all you need for a good place to eat right?

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. &#34;....and that&#39;s how I became a gynecologist.&#34;

REpu3He_Uo2qqNESBf36wQ.text: I went here ever so eager. My eyes went wide at the menu - so many possibilities and so many sauces to try.  I opted for the standard wings. And went with trying 4 of the sauces - hot, damn hot, chili lime, and habanero honey. Blue cheese and ranch for dipping. Also ordered fries with fry sauce and potato salad.  The wings themselves are nice and plump. Very good quality. And the wings are actually breaded, which can be hard to do well. But the breading was nice and crisp and had a good flavor. So all is good with the actual wings.  The sauces, though, are lacking. The hot was actually more like a mild. Zero heat and little flavor. The chili lime was similar. I could barely tell it was chili lime there was so little flavor. The habanero honey also had zero heat and was too sweet. The damn hot, however, was fabulous. It had heat and flavor, but wasn't hot just for the sake of being hot. So, with the exception of the damn hot (which is the hottest on their menu), if you don't like heat or lots of flavor in your wing sauce, this might be the place for you. This is where they lose major points. The sauce is the most crucial part of the wings.  The blue cheese and ranch were ok, but not great. They didn't add anything to the wings. They're just sorta there.  The fries are really good. They are shoestring fries that are crispy and non-greasy. The fry sauce was just average. They do also offer chili cheese fries.  The potato salad was edible. And that's pretty much the best I can say about it.  Good service. Props for the $1 drafts and all you can eat wings.  Overall, if they could just get some better wing sauces (or my taste buds suddenly deteriorate), I might be back.

jXB9f4qnaxUlwEp_Uh1IIA.text: I've been coming here for the past few years whenever I need my wing fix. Their wings are delicious, but I always opt for their strips just for the mere fact that I never like getting my hands dirty.  I usually order the combo, their fries are so yummy and their wing portions are huge - I can always get away with just three pieces to feel full.  Lemon pepper is usually my go-to flavor but they've got many others to choose from, all of which are just as good.  Definitely better than all the other wing chains in the city.

GDDxnwIHMh0Z36uVQRi_nQ.text: This place is near my place of work so I have ordered from Chicken Shack many times. I always order my food to-go and it's always ready pretty quick and they are consistently delicious! This is kind of a small restaurant so seating is limited here but like I've said, I always get it to-go.

unwUSYzdzPklBR7yxdEK-w.text: Nice little joint you guys got here tucked away in a plaza off of East Sunset Road.  I ordered the number 1 combination which consists of 6 Wings, Fries, and a Drink for 8.29 plus tax. I chose chipotle honey barbeque sauce for the wings which has a nice combination of sweet and spicy. The wings themselves has a slight breading on it which gives it more of a crunch to its crispiness.  As for the fries, SHOESTRING! I dont think I have had shoestring fries that good in a long time. If anything, I would go out on a limb and say it was even better than the wings! I can only fantasize how good their chili cheese fries might be.   They also have chicken strips, burgers, and a salad with your choice of grilled or fried chicken.   Now for the downers. Their prices are bit high for your basic chicken wings. The biggest thing I think that doesnt make sense is that they dont serve you any sauces with your wings like ranch, blue cheese, etc. Of course you can have your choice of dipping sauce but only if you wanna pay extra. Also if you want veggies like celery or carrots, that is also a separate charge. WHAT? When you think of wings, you see a plate or basket full of wings, fries, veggies and dipping sauce. That right there is perfection. I can think of many other places that give you dipping sauces and veggies included with your meal or at least free when you ask for it.   With everything mentioned, mostly good and a little bit of bad, this warrants 4 stars. To the owners, if you are reading this, a little bit of sauce and veggies goes a long way.

e4DpJ995DYdUs2JemqGPSg.text: After living in Vegas for a year, I'm used to going to places with high ratings/reviews and being underwhelmed. This place lived up to the hype! Large, meaty wings in great sauces, with surprisingly tasty shoestring fries- and I don't even like the shoestring cut! Service was also surprisingly friendly and prompt, so don't let the location and exterior fool you.  The #4 combo is the way to go for a little of everything: 3 wings, 3 strips, fries, a drink (fountain), and toss in bleu cheese or ranch for just under fifty cents extra. Your total is under $10 and it's enough to stuff you to the gills or share (though for dinner I'd add on an extra 6-piece).  Habanero honey and jamaican jerk are really tasty sauces- as my BF said, I'd buy these bottled if they were available! The bleu cheese dressing tastes homemade, which makes paying extra for it a little less annoying.  Wish they had more than one location- I think they'd do well on the West side (hint, hint).

jGeTKUSLSTk06NyisT4hPg.text: The name Chicken Shack accurately describes what this place is. The facility is extremely small and can barely hold the amount of customers coming in and out. The chicken fingers are some of the best in town, not because they're the highest of quality, but rather they're cooked just like southern chicken fingers. If you can get your mind away from how uncomfortable the facility is, you'll definitely appreciate what Chicken Shack has to offer.

uP7qYEs95mDAzMoLc1h_eg.text: Been coming here for years, and service has reached such a low that I feel compelled to write a review about it. But first, the food:  The food is okay. People writing reviews about "omg best chicken ever!" are probably comparing it to McDonalds chicken nuggets. The tenders are fairly dry and the wings are not much better. Their BBQ sauce is actually pretty decent but the other ones I've had (ranch and bleu cheese) are bad.   The crux of my review is the customer service. A bad experience will sour my entire meal, no matter how good the food is. I feel like the owners have an ongoing contest to see how rudely their cashier can treat their customers while still staying in business. Every single time I come in I get the stink eye and get attitude from the cashiers. I mostly ignore it because my mom loves to get the food here so I bring her here, but after the way I was treated today I will absolutely not be coming back.

gmQQhijF_NMSYZAvl-LvkQ.text: Now this establishment takes the award for best customer service of the day. When you come here you get such a homey feeling where you can just relax and eat good food.   Like it's name suggests the Chicken Shack specializes in Chicken; Chicken Sanwiches, Chicken wings, Chicken Fingers, Chicken Everythang!!   My friend Anthony and I had the honor of trying the "6 piece chicken fingers with medium sauce" and the "chicken sandwich" both of which were cooked to the point of perfection. The meat was so tender that it would literally melt in your mouth.   And while we were enjoying our meal the cook had overheard that it was our first time at the establishment, so he brought out a sample side of wings with 2 of their different flavors of sauces!! Honey Jabanero and Sweet Chilli, which completely topped off out whole eating experience!  As we finished our meal we noticed how much like family they treated all of their customers. While calling regulars by their names and with greetings like "Aye!!!" But what really caught my attention was their willingness to help one of their customers who had a fairly large to go order, out to their car. That's something that's not at all necessary but it's nice to know that they would go that far for their customers.   Overall my experience here was 5 stars for their amazing overall vibe. We'll be back Chicken Shack!

EEEgDMLG0rwRG5VCsnXHhw.text: Best wings in Vegas! I wouldn't go anywhere else to get my wing fix. tkUcm6tYvN2kIeSdb2yCiw.text: Why did the chicken cross the road? Every table at Chicken Shack was full so I took out my chicken and crossed Mountain Vista Road with it to the Ethal M. Cactus Gardens picnic table. So much for my joke, here is my review of Chicken Shack. It is based on my two recent lunch time visits that were on July 9 and today.      Chicken Shack is a small restaurant in the Smith's and Barley's Casino-anchored Shopping center that has masses of people shocking to the southeast corner of Sunset and Mountain Vista. The two times that I have shocked here in the mid afternoon, the place was packed. Today, I barely landed a table when a couple left. I came close to having to take it out to Ethal. M Cactus Gardens for an impromptu picnic. The reason that Chicken Shack is so popular is that they serve quality food at prices that won't burden the wallet in an upbeat environment.     It is funny that many of the hole in the  places that I have dined in are the most fun places to dine in. Chicken Shack is a quintessential example. Adorning the walls are humorous quotes related to chicken jokes, the Chicken Shack mascot that reminds me of a yellow version of Foghorn Leghorn, and license plates from all over. Supposedly every state licence plate is represented on these walls. Here is an example of one of the humorous quotes on the walls of Chicken Shack:      "In my day, we didn't ask why the chicken crossed the road. Someone told us that the chicken crossed the road and that was good enough."  Grandpa    What is not a joke is the food. And plenty of food! On both of my visits I'd order a combo. The combo includes shoestring fries and a Pepsi fountain beverage. In response to the previous Yelpers stating that the shoestring fries were good, I say "Ditto."     On Friday, July 9; I ordered six chicken wings dipped in a hot garlic honey sauce. The price of the meal was $9.95. If I opted for one of the sundry dipping sauces, I'd pay an additional 50 cents. After taking my $ and name, they brought the food to my table a few minutes later. Sharing the table with the chicken wings combo was a roll of paper towels. They were necessary. These chicken wings were the stickiest finger food that I remember eating in a long time. This might go down as the stickiest finger food or thing that I reviewed on Yelp. I got extraordinary use out of the paper towels. With that said, Chicken Shack chicken wings and texting is a bad combination. When I got past the consistent reaching back and forth to the paper towels, the chicken wings were all right. They were loaded with  white meat and flavor.     Today, I ordered the chicken sandwich combo for $6.99. They gave me a choice between crispy and grilled. I chose grilled. It was worth the long wait. This leads into me recommending passing over Chicken Shack if your in a hurry. This isn't a fast food joint where the chicken is sitting under a lamp. When the chicken sandwich arrived, I was like, "Wow." The sandwich was stuffed with three mutant chicken fingers, lettuce, onions, and tomatoes next to a large portion of shoestring fries. Two of the pictures below show the giant sandwich. It is safe to say that I did not leave hungry.      In the future I conceive visiting Chicken Shack to put their chicken fingers to the test. Ideally this will be at their Boulder City location after hiking. In the present I give Chicken Shack my 4 star stamp of approval.

NgAwfpXjrGSLzkoPkkQwpw.text: The chicken was great!! If you like Raising Canes, you'll love Chicken Shack! It's like a more homemade canes with more variety on the menu. I expected the food to take a little longer to be prepared than Canes, but it was actually brought out to me extremely fast.  Not only is the food great, the service is excellent. I had Eddie as a cashier and he was very friendly and helpful. He brought the food to our table and even came by to check up on us and asked how everything was knowing it was our first time there! He was kind and courteous to even the children in the restaurant no matter how busy it got! That guy would be an excellent waiter.  I will definitely be returning to chicken shack for the tasty chicken fingers, bomb sauces, and friendly employees.  ALSO I LOVE THEIR CRISPY SHOE STRONG FRENCH FRIES!!! I prefer these to crinkle cut fries any day!

mguzpevr5dME0dEK3Hmgcw.text: I've been to Chicken Shack several times now since it's just a quick walk away during lunch time. The food comes out quickly, service is great and its affordable. I've tried a few of their items on the menu.  The chicken tenders are very juicy and come in larger portions. Sometimes they'll even give one extra chicken tender with your meal. The fries....don't get me started. I. love. chicken. shack. fries. Sometimes they can be on the salty side, but they are the thin, shoestring kind and they are always perfectly crispy!! I'll admit...I've gone just for the fries before...(Don't judge me). Don't forget to ask them to toss your chicken in your selected sauce, or else it will come on the side. I've tried about half of their sauces available and all are yummy. You can't go wrong with which ever sauce you choose. I usually get the buffalo and ranch. Their ranch is so good. I've also had their salad for a healthier alternative with grilled chicken. Its not bad for healthy...but if you're going there you might as well indulge and get the fried stuff!  Definitely my go to spot if I'm craving some chicken tenders!

sjS2WEKzjIBYlynSp0uGdQ.text: Breaded chicken strips and fries are amazing! Chicken strips are really thick and tender as well. They also carry an amazing array of dipping sauces! One interesting note is that the fries are super thin and crispy. They are truly addicting!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

SEdc4j4hCr9bc0s3g5vjXA.text: Love to eat at this place whenever possible. We typically order for the "shack pack" and up the fries with chilli and cheese combo. The chicken fingers are big and tender. We like it so much that we forget to try and order the wings. There are so many sauce I could recommend. Number one recommendation is definitely the Creamy Garlic Parmesean. My favorite is Habanero Honey. If you want a real change of flavor, try either the Jamaican Jerk or the Chile Lime. Staffs are always friendly. There are seating outside. Next visit we'll try that Fried Twinkies.

hxs78fo7olvHGJPlkKc7fA.text: This really sucks because it was my first time there and the wings I ordered were really really dry. I don't like breading on my wings but I thought hey everybody says it's really good and the couple of reviews I read on here were good...but one shining light was the service, the people who work there are really nice and just excellent service sorry to say I only ate two of the wings but the fries were awesome...I want my money back spent 18$ on 12 wings and fries so not worth it unfortunately I will not return.

RjXWjTwALpi0zYc3S6-jBQ.text: What is fry sauce? Synthetic Innout sauce. It tasted so fake, I don't even want to know what's in it. The honey mustard also still tasted like it was made in a laboratory and was not meant to be consumed. What are you guys using to make this stuff?!  The chicken is oily and heavy on the breading. Choose fingers over wings. If you're looking for wings go elsewhere. The fries are shoestring fries and they're pretty good if you get lucky. If you're unlucky, they'll be overfried and you'll regret eating them. The sauces for the chicken are all free, the other sauces, such as fry sauce, are 39 cents.

E2-199-Ag_3ppp3e75vO9g.text: Good wings when you can get them but two different times we've ordered and received fingers NOT wings. So frustrating when their nice at the register but when you get home it's not what you paid for; we gave them the benefit of the doubt the first time so we thought it would of been fixed this time since the owners were the ones we talked to the first go around. We were wrong. They fixed the order but still an inconvenience for a place that's only a few months out.

4dPb6mY1n2i0We7qRKQJRA.text: *Military Discount*  This was one of my favorite jokes when I was growing up:   Q. Why did the chicken cross the road? A. To show the possums how it's done.  I don't know why but it cracked me up every time.  It seems pretty dumb now LOL   Went on Friday 3-11-16 at noon for lunch.  This restaurant is located on Mountain Vista & Sunset in the Smith's shopping center.  The place was totally packed!!  Seems to be a popular spot for lunch.   It's kinda small inside but they do have some outdoor seating.    $16.51 got us a 6-wing basket with a drink and a chicken sandwich basket with a drink. It came out super fast!    Their chicken is crunchy on the outside although a bit bland but they have some tasty sauces for dipping to make up for that.  The wings were full of raw, yellow, fat which I HATE but not so much that I wouldn't eat them again.    Their fries are the skinny shoe-string type and were hot and crunchy.  Their soft drink machine must be calibrated perfectly because their mountain dew is pretty much the best I've ever had.   Overall a solid place to have lunch and not too hard on the wallet.  Their ranch is out-of-this-world AMAZEBALLS.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich. 3-11-16
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. 6 wings with fries, mild sauce &amp; ranch on the side. 3-11-16

845rWQdy74N5r9U36CGI0w.text: Exactly what it should be. Fast food chicken fingers and wings with a HUGE choice of dipping sauces.  Overly salty and greasy for me - but the chicken seemed very good quality, and the portions were large.  Tiny place. No ambiance to speak of - other than a wall of "Why did the chicken cross the road?" jokes. (some of which were actually pretty cute - but it wears off quickly).   Because of the limited menu, this probably won't be a regular stop for me. But if I'm craving wings or fingers, this is definitely the place.

lLQRCjw4b0zjvTvBzpi7yA.text: Great place! Great Chicken (had the wings) and very friendly service. Clean and pictures on the walls seem like they are really embedded in the community. Lots of local kid's sports teams etc. I'm usually a Popeye's fan but this seems like a locally owned place and is easily my new favorite.

MvdpBNLDdGf0InJM9fExEw.text: Been meaning to give a review awhile now. We make a trip to Vegas every 3 months. If you're craving for wings, come here. Wings are amazing. Always juicy and crispy. Couldn't make the trip home without bringing an order of 50 wings for my kids. Popped them in the over for few minutes and they said it tasted like they were at the restaurant.

QT2P5W5Mrz1wVWmtwcrgew.text: The chicken was thick and juicy. (+) The fries were decent, I've had worse and better. (-) The dipping sauces I had was spicy BBQ and regular BBQ and both were amazingly great! (+) We ordered a 3 piece combo and a 5 piece. We received an extra chicken finger in both combos (10 pieces total) (++++++++++++++++)  Customer service was very nice friendly

IekRU3DKvQydyK2Y3uJ0sQ.text: My son & his friends LOVE chicken shack so I decided to give it a try. It is a very busy place so they must be doing something right. My biggest complaint is how small the place is. I was placing an order to go, the counter to order is in the back, there is a 4 top on the left & the soda dispenser on the right. I have an 18 month old & had her with me. So trying to not have her grabbing or hitting the people at the table & not play with the soda machine left VERY LITTLE room. I was in the way of staff coming from the back to hand out orders & for people trying to get refills. We finally get to the counter & I asked a few questions making it obvious it was my 1st visit. I place an order for 24 lemon pepper wings & a garlic Parmesan fingers meal. I pay & turn around to go wait & there's nowhere to go. They was 3 people in line behind me 2 other people waiting for their to go orders & 2 people trying to get refills. SO CROWDED. I finally get out of the way & go to wait at a 2 top, the only open table. My order didn't take to long. I get home w it & unpack it & there was no sauce for anything, wings, fingers or fries. I'm assuming now it's something you order as well. That would've been nice to know.   Now the food itself, it was very good. The chicken was cooked to perfection & the fries were great. We will go back but try different flavored, the lemon pepper was good, garlic Parmesan needs more garlic & Parmesan. We'll also be sure to ask for sauces!

Nno-sbZRiIlkrwmTQeuleg.text: Loved this place.  Awesome big juice and crispy chicken wings and all white meat tenders.  If you like a bit of spice, have have habanero honey sauce.  Amazing.  Fries are crispy shoestring.  Busy place to prepare to be patient to find a table to seat yourself at.  Worth the wait.

revIYXX4CYN_a27oRwM3Ng.text: I went yesterday and we got honey BBQ wings with fries and fry sauce. Everything was delicious and the employees were all very nice. We ordered way too many wings, so we brought them home and they were still really good after I microwaved them! I will definitely be going back.

rtGtkFjfs4U1_-IOQVemEA.text: Food = great! The people = great.  We go there all the time! Sooo good Fries = yum Cannot go wrong !

wnnqxLR_F5YXFHeEjO1MDQ.text: The staff inside is really cool and down to earth. The flavor to the wings are nice but I recommend eating there or not driving to far . The chicken because it's breaded will become very soggy and a mess all over your fries. I made a stop so the food set for about 15 mins. I will try again maybe next time I will get regular chicken or eat there.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Nice flavor will become soggy if not eaten right away due to chicken being breaded

6doyn1hXOvNa92flfuJHTA.text: Obsessed with this place !!!!  Better than Buffalo wild wings, better than wing stop just amazing! Their fries are the best and the staff is always nice !

61KCa5PKs4GJMWl_qISsRQ.text: Being a vegetarian, every time I came to Smith's just next door I couldn't help but become overwhelmed by the awesome smell that came from this place. So, I had to bring mom to taste it and give me a full review.  She said the wings were awesome and would love to come back, but they weren't as good as hers. ;)  I also learned they have chicken tenders and will have to come and try those for myself, considering I have jumped off the veggie train after ten years and dying to  see if the taste matches the aroma. Come and check this hidden gem out if you are a fan of good chicken. My nostrils and Mom's taste buds are saying you probably will not be disappointed.

eY18gE-D4-op0LHV2dTeUA.text: This is my go to place for Chicken wings in Las Vegas!  It took me a while to find a great wing place, as sadly Vegas does not have many, but when I found this place I was hooked!   First and foremost they have sweet tea!  For me this is a big win as I grew up in the south and sweet tea is the House Wine for any southerner.  And yes there is a major difference between making sweet tea and taking a sugar packet and adding it to unsweetened tea! hahahaha  The quality of it can very.  Sometimes it is great and other times it is not. But hey I am in Vegas so I cant be too picky lol  As far the chicken wings they are HUGE!  Much larger then a normal wing.  Not sure where they get the chicken from but the chickens must have a weight room and spent the day bulking up.  The wings are pretty tasty and fried well.  6 wings here is definitely a good size meal.    The sauces vary in good to OK.  After trying a multitude of them I have settled on the Hot BBQ and the Hot Teriyaki.  I like the heat that both provide along with the balanced taste of the BBQ Sauce and Teriyaki sauce.   I am not a huge fan of the Lemon Pepper as it can tend to be on the really salty side along with being a dry rub.  The past couple of times I have been they have added new flavors.  This is always nice to see as it shows they are experimenting with new things.  I always make it a point to try the newest ones.  They can usually be found on the chalk board next to the register.   The fingers are also really good and they have meals that are reasonably priced.  They come with fries and a drink!  The fires are also a plus as they are on the thinner side.  I would recommend trying the fry sauce with them.    The decor is all based on the joke why did the chicken cross the road.  If you dine in or are waiting for your food they are pretty entertaining to read.  They also have some TVs and a little outside seating.  Overall it is a small space so not a ton of seating.    I would call there style of wings pretty standard, nothing fancy, just wings fried and served tossed in pretty typical choices.  If you have never been I would give it a whirl as it is much better then most of the places that sell wings here in Vegas.

l_NJUWiS24bNWTEE5m_06g.text: The food was delicious! I came out to Las Vegas for vacation but also visit a good friend. He would always check in on Facebook at The Chicken Shack. I told him he will need to take me there for lunch. The best idea we both had. The chicken fingers were flavorful, juicy, and delicious. I had honey BBQ, the sauce was very light and flavorful. I will come back whenever I visit again.

jNGaR3lLm4_858ix-h1pPg.text: It was my first time! I came with my boyfriend and our 2 girls and it was amazing!!! I definitely will come back, maybe even this week lol! The customer service alone, without even trying the food yet was outstanding. The food just topped it off. :)

XZ6FKsKmoFlZH-N2lOAAcA.text: Awesome place. I've ate Chicken Shack twice now. This is the BEST wing spot in the Vegas/Henderson area PERIOD! Trust me on that. Also the service is great as well. Btw, they are a part of the postmates delivery service so you don't even have to leave your house!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. 6 Wing Combo

s5N_xp-LsD2MBq9Ok_L7Kg.text: Absoulty the best wings I've had in Las Vegas.   Went early in the morning for chicken and waffles.   Well priced, 4 wings and the perfect waffle.     Recommend if your in Henderson and hungry stop by.  The wings reminded me of what the originals hooters wings used to be like.   Fresh, crunchy and cooked perfectly.   The spicy ranch sauce whoever made that up deserves a raise.   Check it out.

JLeuOwQP2RMSBLcB8g-45g.text: Back for dinner tonight. This place rocks it. The chicken is fresh and good. The fries are unreal. They have about 15 different sauces. This place does it right. Food fresh, service fast. Still not the cleanest place. But, you have to realize they never stop frying chicken and fries.  Bound to be a challenge to keep clean.

ksR7v2WjMuj5Vt_ZGKuwrg.text: Chicken Shack. I'll keep you my dirty little secret. Don't tell anyone. yelp.com/biz_photos/aqwn... Who has to know? Best fingers. Best fries. That's all you need to know.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. I love me some Chicken Shack. This shit is BOMB!

kwxgapYZpt0ATEAwyGx4ew.text: The wings were really good but the customer service left something to be desired. It was my first time going there and the cashier had no patience when I was ordering my meal. While deciding on my options the cashier rudely remarked "Well I guess you don't like answering questions". The experience left me very frustrated. Next time I will pass on this place and go somewhere I can enjoy my meal and my ordering experience.

FGEJsTjMfq45xT7k62ScpA.text: Have been to this place several times and have not been disappointed. I've tried several of the sauces and each one has been flavorful and the portion sizes are more than enough. I get the 3 piece tender meal and more often than not get 4 tenders, so I'm assuming it's done by weight and not just a number. The counter attendants are extremely nice and courteous, even when it's busy.   While True, sometimes the some of tenders can be a little dry, it's not something that ruins the meal and everything else far outweighs this issue. Highly recommend.

cxxj16ZYTrxs3d6kQNFAjA.text: Always delicious, always fresh.  My got too fast food place in Henderson. Just wish they were open later and that they delivered.

K6pzuBZy1_vDIpi0QDpfOA.text: You come here for the chicken, however, you will be disappointed if you need a clean setting to eat. The food is nice, where the chicken is juicy and breaded with a nice crisp. My favorite sauce Is this sweet chili. I ask for it on the side, because I like to dip it. The fries are shoe string, but a much better quality than fast food joints. It's crunchy but still has a good amount of potato innards. The main problem I see about the chicken shack is how so many people come, dine in, and go that the workers have no time to clean. They are too busy cooking abd taking orders. Therefore, crumbs are everywhere, no clean tables, and trash cans get filled. I recommend then for take out. If you dine in, you could actually wipe your table using Pattie towels and their fountain water.   Anyways, the pros outweigh the cleanliness con. Go try it!

E_SlaxZrPKBMmbGVtnLTEg.text: We came in and the line was out the door. They took orders crazy fast! We had our order less than 5 minutes from ordering! AMAZING SERVICE! Employees are smiling and happy to be a work. The food is fresh, HOT, and tastes AMAZING!!! I only wish we had one in the SouthWest. We will always return!! Leaving happy and with a full bell!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. So yummy!!!

SQCZ7bsCG2U6CJ9kn8XU6g.text: If I eat any more of their strips, I will grow feathers.  This unassuming small eatery has great strips.  I am the kind of person that tries to eat things I wouldn't normally cook, and chicken strips is one of those  things on my "don't buy it if you can cook it" foods.  I gave in to my hubby's begging to try this place one day after work.  We drove from the southwest to Henderson just for these strips, and I told him, "these better be awesome for the trip."  Fortunately, he was right--the strips are awesome.  They are huge (I'm wondering what size these chickens are) and juicy.  Their coating is great and the sauces are wonderful.  I love their shoestring fries, but I was honed in to those strips and downed three on my own.  I even gave the wings a try, and they are quite tasty.    Overall, a great place to stop for some chicken.  I will drive down to Henderson just for these strips despite a closer competitor.  They're awesome.

hv5MG-aTEPft3DQ44YRkww.text: This place was good. Good price for wings, fries and a drink. Two of my boyfriends chicken fingers were overdone but overall will be coming back. Place stayed busy

u3jrNPUkHbmoLhOP0zaGmA.text: Try the chicken salad with some sauce on the side. Can't beat it.

PuhK7dEU09BUU-BLEkpV8w.text: Awsome wings and chicken, plenty of different sauces,  1.00 beers!

EAWckxQzhWTahECC4ZJ2Qw.text: Absolutely the best chicken tenders, wings, and fries around. The service is friendly and fast.

UydYqt-JQK84CTzlUKI9rA.text: Had a very enjoyable experience at The Chicken Shack. The food was quick to be served and tasted great! Not to mention the service was an A+!

6Dm0B-DbmMgbVzTHwDBsLQ.text: good "hole-in-the-wall". great chicken. a touch salty, but still pretty damn good, hand-breaded and fresh.   i give it an overwhelming thumbs up!

2YzQ9aLXIBQB_lHg3pIN1A.text: There hot sauce is super good!!! They make really good chicken strips too. The people working there are very nice.  The only critique is I wish they had more chicken sandwiches on their menu or variety

Fo4GVFyWlbh6VDUUvatB2Q.text: Came here for the first time the other day ordered a combo of chicken wings and tenders with French fries and a drink. Took about 8min or less. Chicken fingers were probably one of the best I've had ! They're so juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. The mild sauce was great in flavor. I actually like the really thin French fries. We'll definitely be coming back for more!

RIezFDm673X6aXdt5mSXyg.text: I've been coming here for 5 years. Food and service has always been good and the owners really are cordial. Feels like family almost. You HAVE to try the lemon pepper!

aclSi942st-LoQ5OipcgIA.text: When you walk in and view the menu, you think you are in "Chicken Heaven". There are a variety of flavors and various seasonings you can choose for your fries. However, I was not impressed. I ordered the chicken wing and chicken strip meal with a side of fries. The chicken was cooked to a golden crisp and served hot. I ordered the garlic Parmesan, and thought it was waay too salty. Also, a few of my pieces of chicken were undercooked. The restaurant is small, so I had to get my food to go. I have heard mixed reviews and though my experience was not the greatest, I am willing to give Chicken Shack a second chance.

6kEfcbn-uggWOTbUns7mOg.text: A young Rex...a young taught schoolboy Rex...was once a star athlete. I was good at all of the sports the other boys wished they were. I was great at shooting dice, 3 Card Monty, pick pocketing and loan sharking. I was the envy of my entire 3rd grade class. Very few kids that age can play the shell game on a street corner for 8 hours and then kneecap some deadbeat over a 20 dollar debt at night.  I was a machine...a well oiled, tight bodied machine. The girls...oh the girls...nap time was a special time. A young Rex surrounded by his prepubescent harem.  It was magical. I was on top of the world.  My aunt Eunice would see me come back with some old man's pension check, because he owed 3 weeks of the vig after betting on the Giants, she would beam with pride.  We would go to our special place...and then he would take me for food. I deserved it...believe me. She would buy me fried chicken. I loved it. It washed out the taste of low tide. Bribe sweet bribe. Bribed my silence.  As an older man I look back on those days and still cringe. Sure the money was good. Sure the chicken was good. The rest...not so much.  I tell this tale of woe and want for one reason...all of that great chicken was almost blotted out of existence from a combination of court ordered therapy, LSD, electroshock, and Kenny G Therapy...my own creation...not for the week of heart.  I discuss it in detail in "Kenny G: How the Devil Gave Us Therapy."  Those great chicken dinners would be lost to the recesses of my mind...just flickering images...like the ones I see of me standing on top of a building, naked, wearing a beer hat and smoking a cigar...images of meaningful nonsense. That was until I went to the Chicken Shack. Oh, sweet Chicken Shack. Let me hold you. Let me kiss you. Let me call you aunt...wait...never mind.  Chicken Shack does what it does...and it does it amazingly! Chicken Shack chicken is never frozen. The breasts and the wings are huge...like Busty Dusty big. Ah, memories...I almost suffocated at a club in Pittsburgh once.   The 5 strip lunch/dinner is more than enough for the biggest eater.  It comes with fries and a drink for under 8 bucks.  Fountain drink for unlimited soda. I saw these two huge fat guys mowing down a 5 piece. They looked full. They looked content. They looked like they had hypertension. God Bless America. The wings are excellent but I recommend the strips. More meat. Tender. Juicy. Delicious. Same price.   The sauces. The sauces are key to a place like this. Like having weed on you when trying to sleep with Jennifer Aniston. Mandatory.  Well, Chicken Shack doesn't disappoint. Recently I had the special Habenero Honey. It was sweet. It was hot. It hurt a little bit after 4 pieces. It hurt the good way...like being dumped by Amanda Peet...that body can only keep you happy for a long time...then you are just praying for a stroke.  The BBQ sauce is excellent. The Garlic Parmesan sauce is absolutely amazing. The chili lime isn't very good, sorry. Too limey...like Hugh Grant.   If chicken isn't your thing...then you think that Rex will tear into you for going to THE CHICKEN SHACK...but no...not at all...they have a burger there that is amazing. A single. A double. A triple. You can add cheese and bacon. Yes...triple cheese and bacon.  Oh is it good...it's really good. I ate it. I cried. I ate it again. I cried harder. I threw a chair out the window. I ran.   They have an all you can eat chicken wing and 1 dollar beers. If that doesn't sound good to you then you are a loser. I say that with no hesitation. No remorse. No second guessing. You are the type of person who would hold up a bank but leave the stuff in the safe.  The atmosphere is great. They have funny slogans on the wall. Cute. Sickeningly cute. Rex is sarcastic. Rex hates it. Others will love it.  The bottom line is that this is obviously a family place run by people who actually care. Rex is very happy to find a local business that prides itself on quality and building an ongoing local relationship with customers. Nice owners. Great food. Local. Cheap. Quality.   When Rex dies please batter and deep fry him. He deserves the honor. Take a bite. Take a big bite. You love the way hate tastes.

e19vA-PLjePiJ77hkg3s1g.text: EVERY time I visit Las Vegas, this is my first stop.  There are few food items in this world I would choose to eat over the Chicken Shack chicken sandwich.

obwf3fs_LZtiE-S97BNgyw.text: If you like chicken wings with a pound of breading and batter on them then this is your.place. You cant get there chicken wings unbreaded at all instead you get a mouthful of oily batter. The fries were not bad but not amazing there were just average fries.

Ybw90craFo_XglPb2HxlXA.text: Great wings... WAY better than BWW and cheaper too.  Very small place so be prepared to share a table or get it to go.

tdeKlsgUAFILJ-ndwQsamQ.text: Great wings, fingers and FRIES!!! Cozy atmosphere.  You have a returning customer... Like mentioned... passed by many a times... and finally went in and yayyyyyyyy was satisfied.....

goCorWAjxBBXsQneeJJMMg.text: Chicken fingers are AMAZING. Friendly staff. Great chili cheese fries! Try the spicy blue cheese!! Will definitely be coming back!

lePWcA0wXtDKWwwEMJqnYg.text: My youngest son loves chicken wings.  Actually the whole family does.  We discovered this gem of a eatery via Yelp and visit every time we are in Vegas.  Even if we are not staying very close by.  Why?  Because the wings are plump, juicy and delicious. We had the sweet chile, honey bbq, teriyaki and buffalo medium.  Everytime we have been here, John was behind the counter and taking care of us.   Very friendly and patient and has great suggestions.  It is obvious from the steady flow of patrons that the wings are delicious.  We also had the shoestring fries and coleslaw.  Coleslaw was ice cold and kind of sweet but definitely great.  And the fries disappeared almost as fast as the wings.  I wasn't sure the 36 wings would feed the five of us but the wings are so big that we left full.  No leftovers.  My only comment would be that the orders had a much higher percentage of drummettes than wing sections.  I prefer the wing but I am guessing John could make that happen for me next time.  Worth the trip and forget about the decor.  The chicken is the draw here.

yFm9kVmgHl_vj995dt8XKg.text: Chicken Shack has the most amazing fried chicken and fries to be found in the Vegas area. I dream of this place, it's that good. People concerned with their health need not bother, come here if you want to assault your arteries with fried chicken greasy wonder and salt. Lots of great sauces, bone-in or boneless, heck they even have a Gardenburger. The fries are splendid. The location is small, the tables are sticky. It's perfect.

EPGplK4DfPd1qNMpZfJIRw.text: Enjoyed Chicken Shack so much my second trip was only three days after my first! They have a sauce for everyone (try the jerk) & wings are the size they're SUPPOSED to be (big)!! They even have salad & burgers if wings aren't your thing.  They offer a really good ayce deal I'm not prepared to take advantage of...  yet.  Located in the same shopping center as Ross J's Aloha Grill  & a Roberto's this is a delicious food run adventure waiting to happen!

G5TKRjqZIQ5dAvrKaI8_OA.text: Hands down best chicken you can get fast for a great price!!!  I've been going here every now and then for about 6 years now since back in the "chicken bonz" days and highly recommend it!!!

Lc6zh_wIfQgxj9tahQLz8A.text: Taste like moms fried chicken Yummy! And who could beat the $1 draft beer, great baked beans and mustard potato salad. (Why do most people make it mayo? It's just not right.) The family was divided on which sauce is the best. Top picks: chili lime, honey BBQ, Jamaican Jerk. Oh and my daughter believes the tea rates right up there with good southern tea.

GoTioVMbwtcG2hu2GC9rDg.text: I go there with my girls and mom. We love it! I dont like honey mustard that much but theirs is really, really good.  Chicken is excellent!  My mom loves the fries! It get really busy at lunch and the place is small. So plan ahead, i would say

NlgPsd_OhwQR0ieCmYkuAA.text: Best wings in vegas.  Large serving size and great price. They offer kids meals as well great family stop. The jokes on the wall provide entertainment and make the chicken shack a fun environment.

t77Jis_u4WP-88JrduUydQ.text: these are the best chicken wings I've had.  Now, my scope is limited to hooters, bars, and such when consuming chicken wings but, I have eaten many many chicken wings.    These are really crispy, good wing sauce, good blue cheese dressing.  I also ate the chicken fingers.  My friend didn't like them naked.  I believe these are the best chicken fingers I ate as well.  I liked the chicken fingers naked.  These fingers were thinly battered and just super fried.  Once again, you may decide that you like a whole bunch of batter on your fingers.  I haven't tried anything else. I plan on going back and finding it out.  If you are in the hood' this is the place for wings.

IMSg43wK1-YUOMd9B4YG_A.text: Love their chicken fingers but they need to really work on service. Each time I call to place order the order taker never repeats order and then they feel annoyed that you expect them to...Sorry but I too worked in fast food establishment and was taught to repeat order with customer. Sometimes they are not clear with their own menu. But good enough to go back.

8cd6ovnENx3a75BziL4kbA.text: I usually love this place, but tonight around 6;45 (they are open until 9), the employee lied and say the "Fryer was down..."  It was obvious he just wanted to leave.  I am fine with places closing early on the eve of holidays, but they need to post it ahead of time, not lie. Disappointed. Not sure if we will return....

zzxolr2ji5YkF4Sk-GJ1kA.text: Why'd the chicken cross the road? To go to Chicken Shack...duh! ha ha  I've been to Chicken Shack a few times now, and it's been consistently good. For about $6.00, you can get fries, 3 chicken strips, and a soda - Combination #3 on the menu...they also have beer (on tap) for around a $1.00, but the selection is limited. Both times I've been, the place has been packed with people. It's a small space, but I've always been able to snag a table. I like when a restaurant has some personality, and this place is anything but boring! The staff is friendly, the patrons are lively, and the walls are covered in funny phrases that reference chickens...on top of that, the service is usually pretty quick.  Okay, now for the food. The star here is the chicken. It's crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside...it's surprising that with no bone they are able to keep the chicken so tender and juicy, but somehow they manage to do it. I should mention, too, that these are NOT little chicken strips...they are plump pieces of all white meat (their chicken is the antithesis to McDonald's ha ha). Every time, my friend thinks that he needs the 5 piece, and although he finishes them, he always says it was too much food! Everyone is different, but the 3 piece combo has always been plenty for me. I get the Habanero Honey BBQ sauce on the side, and also order a side of blue cheese. One of my pet peeves at restaurants is when they nickle and dime you, and here the blue cheese/ranch/extra sauce is an extra $0.49/$0.35...I'd rather them just factor that cost into my food. The fries are good, but after eating my chicken, I find that it is salt overload...  The reason I come here is for the chicken. They execute it well, and they're consistent. If you're craving some fried chicken, skip KFC and check this place out!

5e0-8JTyvvatfbyl9bNZIw.text: My girlfriend and I arrived at Chicken Shack at 8:30 on a Friday night. As we walked in most of the dining area had the chairs on top if the table tops and an employee was sweeping the room. I find this so annoying as they aren't supposed to close for another half hour. When I ordered the guy behind the counter seemed like he wished we hadn't walked in. He turns and asks the cook if the fryer is "still on". Why wouldn't it be on?  You don't close for another 30 minutes. We sit at one of the few remaining tables to wait for our food. When my order comes up they call my name and say "Aaron! Togo!"  Umm, no I didn't order it togo, but we can take your rude hint and we leave. I work in the restaurant industry and I know that your closing time means that's when you stop taking orders or seating people. Sorry if you had big plans for a Friday night but I had plans too. Plans to get some delicious fried chicken wings and fingers and hang out with my girl. We left very disappointed on our first and LAST experience at Chicken Shack, and not due to the food though which was very good. But there are too many great spots in town where we can get good food AND at least decent service.

0qMxj7To9gFbsqi1p3EfIw.text: I've been coming here for over 5 years.  Amazing food!  Wings, strips and chili is the best in this city.

mZmJDRZvKHPHepyIXX7JfQ.text: Not to much of a chicken person, but decided to join in with some friends. Chicken Stack is actually very good, I was pretty impressed. Got to bring my family here to try it they love chicken wings. This place is hidden in shopping center only way we knew about this place was through yelp.

1tXkFQ4p4AXuG7RZ67EHUw.text: Best chicken fingers in town, noisy always crowded at noon but food is good hot and plentiful!! I'm never disappointed plus they take good care of regulars!

AKZPxNzF_tuv2SAIo9iwog.text: Good but Raising Canes chicken fingers are better IMO. Fries are the bomb!

I04HeOGW6oZ8wqNB_4Bbsg.text: I've been to Chicken Shack several times and have never been disappointed. The chicken is always juicy and the sauces are all great. The staff is very friendly as well.

mtK1IEFST8YRcAS-SIVuAg.text: Was cruising around looking for somewhere to eat and saw the line inside this little joint in a strip mall.  Thought I would try it.  Boy was it good!  I decided to get takeout and I was not disappointed. I got the #4 combo - wings and strips with fries.  They had many sauces to choose from and since no one was in line behind me, the counter guy was extremely accomodating by letting me taste a few sauces to see which one I wanted.  Good price for a quick, delicious meal!  Enjoy the Chicken Shack!

DMcqGEY5yEAW2zPwlafXRA.text: We really liked this place. Order the sauce on the side. We tired the fingers, wings, fries, and potato salad, ranch, bbq and fry sauce  It was great and we had it to go which is so not the same as eating in!  Defiantly will go back!

_gtmSM47hWXu5L-WO6TnXQ.text: I was really hoping to find a suitable replacement for WingStop, since the closest one to us is across town. WingStop back in Cali was my favorite go to spot for crispy well seasoned wings, but I have yet to find a place out here in Henderson near home that can compare. I ordered the #4 which comes with 3 boneless wings and 3 regular wings all in the Lemon Pepper flavor. The fries are pretty tasty - well seasoned super thin shoe string fries, but the wings were too much on the salty side compared to what I'm used to getting with WingStop's lemon pepper wings. Plus, as one Yelper pointed out, they keep their back door open, which you can clearly see from the ordering counter.  That somewhat worries me, for obvious health hazard reasons.... The place is real small, untidy and not as inviting as some describe it to be. It was an okay visit, but I'd rather go elsewhere - even contemplating just sucking it up and travelling across town to get my WingStop fix.

-YQqm3Hl-zfxqqtAXdcQ9Q.text: This place is not bad. My wife were on vacation in Vegas and wanted some wings. Tired of buffets! So we went here, the place is not far from the strip. The place is in a strip mall. We walk in and didn't know what to expect, we found this place on yelp and decided to give this place a try. We ordered some wings, fingers, fries and coleslaw. The wings were good but a little salty for my taste, the fingers were bad had to chew on them for hours before I could swallow the darn thing, will not order fingers again! Coleslaw was bland nothing to rave about. The fries were good, string fries. The tables were not clean. The hot sauce and ketchup bottle was crusty. The workers looked high from smoking weed. This place has good wings but I guess it's a hit or miss with the sauce you choose. Will I go here again, probably yes. I will give them another try.

9Z48at4ZWf_afto1p7DS7w.text: Yummmm is all I have to say.  The chicken fingers were delicious. And I'm not sure of what they do to their fries but they were really good as well. I wasn't a huge fan of their new bourbon sauce or their chipotle bbq (very watery) but everything else was good. I'll definitely go again!

JF-gg73cyRlni9f7zQUTnA.text: My wife and I love to find "hole-in-the-wall" type restaurants.  Unfortunately there aren't a lot of those in the vegas area.  So many are large franchises and corporate style.    Finding Chicken Shack was a thrill!  Not only did it have the small local feel we were looking for, but their chicken strips are hands down the best we have had! The staff was also very friendly and accommodating.  The fry on the chicken is great, and their shoe string fries are delicious.  They have a HUGE selection of sauces you can use for dipping. They also tend to be very generous in proportions!  We've been back many times and take out of town friends there as well.  Love it!

h5_gpxiCj0JwR6tl4Xopaw.text: Best chicken place in Vegas!!! You get a lot of food for $10 and you can taste the quality. Every time I go there they never disappoint!

fg-6vbXxjoHmo73NgbSPCA.text: Read the reviews from this place a couple weeks ago and got excited, and as usual...I was let down!!! I never like to review a place after one visit anymore, so I gave it a couple chances. Fail fail fail.   To succeed in business, you need great customer service. This place does not have it. After reading on their website that they close at 9pm, I get in my car around 7:45pm to travel 11 miles to this place. I arrive around 8:15pm. It's a family of four head of me in line. The guy behind the register is preparing some take out orders and never acknowledged them. They had enough with the waiting, and the lady says she's ready to order. His response? "Oh we're closed". What the hell are you talking about you're closed? He says "we close at 8:30 and its 8:31". I couldn't believe what I was seeing or hearing! If the customer is inside before those doors are locked? You're still open for them!!! The lady and her family angrily walk out, and I do the same. What made me even more mad??? I get to my car and see that it's only 8:24pm!!! The boy was straight up lying to our faces!!!  I told myself that I was done with that place, but because of such high remarks on yelp, I wanted to try the food. Decided to go back the weekend after, early in the day, so I can see if the hype was real. Ordered 3 wings, 3 tenders and fries. Back in college, I worked for KFC... So I know exactly what old fryer oil looks like when used on chicken, and what it smells like. Old oil (reused or not changed) will make your chicken darker, and make it taste funny. This was the case with Chicken Shack. Absolutely nasty. Fries were soggy and lacking taste. It was so bad that it prompted me to go online to find out who owns this place. Whoever you are...we need to speak.   You served me a trash worthy product. Get it together. Will not return.

WSvok1EzVQMPYg111qAqaw.text: We're new to the area, so when we asked the kids what they wanted to eat, our daughter suggested this place we seen on the way to Hoover Dam.   I'm glad we gave it a try. The service was friendly and the customers were as well.   For the price you pay, you get a whole lot.We had the chicken fingers, with 2 large sides and 4 drinks. It was enough to satisfy our hunger. Everything we ordered was yummy, esp the bbq baked beans. If we're ever in the area again, we're definitely going to stop by again to try something new!

tQTpNYCzAHYfM6reKjdslQ.text: The best chicken in town!! And it's still a mom and pop shop!! Love it and the super friendly service!! You eat here once u will comeback for more!! Guaranteed

XyRbfkHYBX30q45zfI9Psg.text: This place has really good food. We used to come here all the time when we lived down the street. We went there today after not going for a long time. We were super excited! We walked in there and the place was disgusting. Chicken bones, straw wrappers, utensils, fries, sticky floors, the soda machine was gross, the tables etc etc..it was so bad we walked out and went somewhere else. On top of all of this, their health card wasn't posted anywhere. I know it's a bunch of young high school kids working there, but come on.

bT4GoZwvj8k_-lzlptuU-Q.text: This place is SO GOOD!!! This is actually the first place ive ate wings since I moved to Vegas a few years ago. And danggg i'm so happy I live right around the corner!!!! Hubby and I tried the medium sauce wings.  The wings are a nice size, super juicy, perfect amount of breading/crunch. Also the sauce was PERFECT!!! Only issue was No dipping sauce was included with our to-go order (perhaps you are supposed to tell them you want some; we were never even asked if we wanted any) Normally I'd detract a star for something like this. But the wings were so good that it honestly wasn't a huge deal not having anything to dip them in.  This is def my new wing spot!!! Cant wait to try their tenders :)

w-rBGEwG9Cju9dU1jEfmeQ.text: Great chicken fingers and good service.  Good value for the money spent. Plenty of sauces to choose from.

f-ugJTETLUpMkOikXs3_6g.text: This review is truly a 3.5, BUT everyone knows how I feel about good service and they had it. I could really make this one short and sweet. Better quality chicken than wing stop or b-dubs, not better sauces. Similar concept, but more mom and pop style instead of chain food. To me you can taste the freshness, which made up for the "just so-so" garlic parm flavor. Also tried spicy teriyaki and I expected more spice. The spicy ranch however was AMAZING. I think their dips are up to par if not better than the rest. I upped it to 4 also because I haven't tried all the sauces yet, and I will for sure return based on quality N service.  Another good local Hendo spot! Check!

5XAwbMIVQBVp8ydmFCCR9Q.text: Brought the kids here for lunch. Stop everytime we come to Vegas. Would have given 5 stars but for the first time we had a rude staff. I was extremely surprised by this. Ordered the Shake Pack with potato salad and baked beans. The food was amazing as always.

Km4X5mOsI0GF5A1a6L-mVw.text: Stopped here for lunch as I was up the road for training. What an amazing place to grab a quick bite. Chicken was cooked to perfection and the shoestring French fries are the best I have ever had (and I have been all over the country). Will definitely make a return trip to this place. My only complaint is that the music is so loud it is hard to hear your order called or carry on a simple conversation.

R8S_H7M4zvZuPWqRorOkTQ.text: By far the best chicken fingers i ever had, and I am a chicken lover ... Platonically of course!  They even taste great cold, amazing quality, the sauces are very good as well...and the wings are very good as well. The fingers deserve 6 stars, hands down.

fTGrs_OwUyORyORurcTWvA.text: Mmmmm good, first timer here. Staff are friendly and fun. Having the chicken fingers and fries real real good. And the sauces, honey/ habenrro and Jamaican jerk awesome. Must be good food, people just keep coming in. Enjoy!

Bz9xpcv8TdI6XCxmKpOnOQ.text: I saw Gregg W's review and have experienced the same thing. I just took mine to go. I was annoyed but I've been a customer before this, so I was already a fan. If it had been my 1 st time, I'm sure I also would have been bothered by it. The staff is comprised of high school kids who are most likely looking to go home, or go somewhere else besides work so it really doesn't bother me that much.   As for the food at The Chicken Shack it is  good. My coworkers are always pushing Canes on me, but bang for Buck The Chicken Shack kills Canes. The fingers are plump and juicy with a light breading that is not overwhelming. The sauces are diverse and tasty. Sweet chili and Habenjero Honey are my two favorites. The fry sauce is a perk for the crisp Shoe string fries. The chicken wings are fantastic as well. Very large and meaty so you get your money's worth.   It is a weekly, or at least bi-weekly regular foe me and my wife. .

ZTLYfKMunSOm72Tu6Zx_oA.text: They are fast good and their chicken quality/size leave others crying  in their buffalo sauce. If their burger buns didn't disintegrate, they would be   better with me. Love it.

PEhIYBvF6ZXPc2BI0KyimA.text: Today was my first time at the Chicken Shack. I went to the new location in Boulder City, NV. The building used to be an old Sonic. It was their grand opening today so the lot was super packed, not a single open spot to park. I parked at the o'reillys and walked over to pick up my phone ahead order. Parking was my only issue, but it may be different when it settles from the excitement, so I won't count that against them.  The aroma was amazing and you can hear them frying up that crispy deliciousness. The establishment was clean and has a few indoor tables as well as outdoor seating. When I got there to pick up my order the line was a good 10 deep. I eventually asked one of the gals if my order was the one on the counter. She started to prepare it for me, but the owner or manager (not sure which, could be both) asked if it would be alright for them to fry mine up fresh since those boxes were sitting for about 30 min.  I had come at the right time (20 min estimated) but they must have finished it up ahead of time. There will be a learning curve for pick up orders so it wasn't a big deal to me. She wanted to make sure my stuff was fresh though so I waited another 5 min, paid for my order and was on my way. I really appreciated her thoroughness and effort in ensuring a quality meal...and they did not disappoint.  The chicken was so tender with just enough crunch on the outside. Super tastey and the portions are huge. We ordered large bc we expected small chicken tenders. These were massive. I could only eat 2 (kiddie size for me next time lol). We chose multiple dipping sauces (I got 4 free with my 20pc order and 2 lg fries...each additional was around 40 cents): Chipotle bbq, regular bbq, hot, sweet chili, honey mustard and of course fry sauce. They were all so good and they are quite large...looked like a 2oz plastic ramekin vs the small 1oz you get everywhere else so that's a plus. The fry sauce had a kick! Loved the skinny "shoe string" style fries also. The large is an entire togo box full at about $4.19 I think. Needless to say, after feeding 4 people, I brought home an entire box of tenders AND another full box of the fries to my kids.  They offer a deal 20pc tender (or 25 pc wing) 2 lg sides and 4 drinks for like $34.99 but I didn't need the drinks, so I just ordered my 20 pc and fries separate.   We will go again sometime. It was great. :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. This was after we devoured an entire box of chicken already and most of the fries from one box. Epic sized portions. Seriously.

F-uEEZ9qfmRwxWCrd--HAw.text: Bathrooms were horrible. Pissy , shitty, & toilet paper everywhere. Will never eat there again. Damn! They can keep one fucking toilet clean?! Lazy people.

whRPonFLmAFu0SGEyFl2iw.text: Before the movies today, my work team decided to have some lunch at the chicken shack.  I've heard some good things about their chicken so I was excited!  When you get there, you'll notice two picnic tables outside for additional seating.  I don't know if the tables are constantly cleaned, but it looked sticky and dusty.  When you get inside, there are tables on both sides of the restaurant:  two tops, four tops and 6 top tables. The inside seemed the same type of cleanliness as the outside tables.  Just looked sticky and a little dirty.  It looks like a small place, however, they seem to be efficient.  A lot of people were there but we fortunately got a few tables fast.  The staff was really nice, a guy and a girl in the front.  They were really busy but kept professional and nice.    For the food, we literally got about 150 pieces of chicken:  100 wings and 50 chicken tenders and a bunch of fries for about $150.  We got a lot of different flavors and sauces on the chicken.  Mild and medium heat chicken wings/tenders, lemon pepper wings and my favorite, garlic Parmesan wings.  The wings are super crispy and juicy inside.  I ate a bunch of wings and they were all cooked perfectly.  The garlic Parmesan really had a lot of flavor and no overly salty.  ON POINT!!!  The lemon pepper flavor wasn't overpowering and managed to still shine through.  I REALLY liked the chicken.  Definitely would recommend the food to someone else!  All in all, we ordered way too many wings for our group of people today.  We literally ended up wasting a bunch of wings because we were going to the movies right after and didn't want to leave the food in the car during the movies.  Aside from that, I was definitely a happy customer and think the wings were great!  Will be back for more :)

Eq5iVwsrFcfoxOvSK54dMA.text: So I've been living here for nearly 2 years and have been to multiple Chicken Shacks around town. This is definitely the gold standard to which all other are compared. foji0wLp0RO6S6pYJevAXA.text: This is the best chicken place in the whole city of Las Vegas. I am sure others might disagree but this place has fresh chicken made to order and also they give you good size portions, they are skimpy on the chicken either they are good sized pieces. This location get busy a lot but its totally worth the wait. They staff is also very friendly and nice to offer items to complete your order in case if one forgets to add something.
