DUtwma7rJppdwZq4Oh_SKg.text: Good food better service. Eddie and the cooks were amazing. Had a smile on their face while taking our order and while serving our delicious food. These guys are professionals! Exceeded all my expectations. Will be returning!

mbonpnqgCz_4zR2Nn1Bwyw.text: The honey bbq smothered with ranch on the side with chicken fingers and wings are my favorite!

jJc6Mg5xLFhdn7LBB3CKDQ.text: Their fries are pretty good and you get a ton of them with your combo, but the chicken is mediocre. Some of their sauces are really good and creative. The chili lime is probably my favorite. The lemon pepper rub was pretty good, but nothing to fan-girl over. But, a lot of their sauces are so-so and in my opinion, are just there so their list of sauces is longer. I got the 'hot honey garlic' thinking I was going to get a sweet and spicy sauce that tasted like garlic because it was in the name, but it tasted like regular bbq sauce. I could see flakes that could have been garlic or chili flakes but it tasted like straight up bbq sauce so I thought they gave me the wrong sauce. I went back and the guy working informed me that the hot honey garlic sauce IS bbq sauce and it is only called hot because they mix the 'damn hot' sauce in it. I don't know about you, but if a sauce is called 'hot honey garlic' I would at the very least expect it to be spicy and have the slightest hint of garlic in it. Or, that if a sauce was a bbq sauce, maybe specify that it is bbq sauce. Bbq is such a strong, specific flavor. It is also one that I hate, so maybe it wouldn't hurt to put bbq in the name so people who are unfamiliar with the sauces and are just trying out a chicken shack sauce for the first time may be able to choose a sauce they would find satisfying. But what do I know right? I'm just someone complaining on yelp. All in all, chicken shack is pretty good, but not my favorite. I think raising cane's in comparison has juicier chicken but chicken shack's chicken is crunchier, although it is also way saltier. Chicken shack definitely gives you more/bigger food, but like I said, their sauces are meh for a place that seems to be all about the sauce options. It would be awesome if they could make a hot honey garlic sauce that was actually that and not bbq. But I will say, when you pay for extra dipping sauce or ranch it comes in a container that is quite big so I mean that's kind of cool but I'm still not a fan and don't really get the hype.

EYFEYU9nyWPY_kLuiVQldw.text: Hands down my favorite hidden gem in Vegas. The portions are huge and the chicken is amazing.

AT-E0Uixfmy2XZonWhpOhw.text: LOVE this place. I've been here 3x in the past 6 weeks or so, and I've gotten the garlic parmesan, mango habanero, honey bbq, and damn hot wings. The damn hots are my favorite with a great balance of vinegar and heat. Honey bbq is a close second. Plus, the fries are some of the best fries I've had. Perfectly seasoned and thin but crispy, not crunchy. I'm hooked!

RwwdIbbWZIO2GV9oLMiQfQ.text: I really love their lemon pepper chicken and garlic Parmesan is really good too. Only thing that I would complain about is you have to pay for their dips which  costs about $.59 for the small one and $2.49 for the large one.

2marDq6rBO7qgVR7kp4RXg.text: I was craving chicken tenders and I came across this place. We came during lunch so the line was long but moved pretty quickly. Small space but we did get a table to sit down and eat at. Everything was hot. It took awhile to get a rogo box but like I said it was lunch time. I will return next time I want chicken tenders!

IM0LMpxPHW9H1J67KgM8Vw.text: Unfortunately my first visit, I had to get a takeout order but the order came out pretty fast!  Their wings are HUGE!!! And they hook it up! Well worth the money!  At first when I walked in, I didn't feel welcome. They didn't greet me so I had to greet them lol.  And I proceeded to order my wings awkwardly. But after I paid, they offered me a water cup while I wait, and told me I can get any fountain drink I wanted! How nice of them  If you order a side of ranch or any sauce their sauce cups are huge so it's easy to dip the wings and portion is a lot too.   I'll be back to dine in soon, especially they have cheap beer too :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Big wings, big sauce cups

JOhPM-vVi2cgFW8VzQlOjw.text: My husband and I have been here a couple times now, and although it's on the other side of town we go out of our way to go. I love the chicken it's super soft and tender, ranch and buffalo sauce and we're set!! It is a little hard to find a table but it's worth it.

8238HWNBB6BwCTBuQOQzqQ.text: This place is always busy. Every time I drive by it the place is full, so I decided to go there for dinner with my girlfriend. My experience there was "ehhhh."  Girlfriend ordered the fried chicken with fries. I got their triple patty burger and fries. We both got drinks with the meal.   First off, the Dr. Pepper machine was not working. Strike 1.   The guy taking my order asked how I wanted my burger cooked, I said medium rare. It came out well done and dryer than moses' nose in the desert. Strike 2.   There was no strike 3 from myself, but girlfriend did not like the chicken and was less than pleased with the meal. She said the chicken was dry and flavorless. With a simple meal like fried chicken, I imagine its hard to screw that up but it happened.   Perhaps I'll give them another chance in the future and maybe we caught them on a bad night. If that's the case, I'll update the review at a later date.

-ICdy_UXha_IEzStwf43-A.text: This eatery should be renamed - The Salty Shack!! I'm a person that generally likes salty foods and will even add salt to my food, but this food was nearly inedible!!  Ordered the 5 piece finger combo. While the chicken itself was moist the batter was so salty, I couldn't eat more than 2 fingers. The fries were nice and thin & crunchy but were also so overly salty that only a few could be eaten.  It's not just the chicken either. My lunch date ordered a burger which also was so salty he could only manage to eat 1/2 the burger!!  Lastly, the side of coleslaw we ordered to share was partially frozen so it also went mostly uneaten.  All in all, even though the ambience is cool, I will NEVER go back!

1RtGpVb5d9jPbnHCZb8QaQ.text: Thinking about wings to hang with my son and instead of Buffalo Wild Wings, we to Chicken Shack based on yelp review from Bethany E.  She gave it a five star and I am glad we tried it!  a.  Location - In a funky odd strip mall near to the great Ross J Aloha Grill!  Plenty of parking and space.  This is a very small place that can seat perhaps 30 people approximately.  b.  The fare - Here you can get hamburger, chicken strips, chili and the famous chicken wings.  You can buy by quantity or in combos.  We decided the 25 piece for 22.89 and also the fries.   c.  The taste - Nice and plump wings with a crispy textured coating. Very nice. Not greasy or anything, just right. The sauces come in a variety of flavors that are given to you free based on the quantity you order.   d.  The extras - If you want something like ranch or blue cheese, this will cost you like .39c per small cup.  Odd, but okay.  The veggies of carrots and celery cost you and is considered a side.  They have small and large side portions including macaroni salad and potato salad.  I am sure there were other things I am missing here as I was focused on the wings.  e.  Speaking of wings - Further to my comments, I did like the wings, however, the ratio of drum sticks to the wing portion was about 3-1 and I prefer the wing portion with the two bones.  f.  A following - When we walked in, we were the only people here. After five minutes, the place was packed!  I say, check this place out. It is not bad at all and for the good ole wing craving, this is a well priced and tasty place.

ttvz78P49cQ6vxgfHGJisg.text: I was told to go to this place multiple times and never made it around to going. The service was extremely fast by the time I got my drink and sat down the food was on my table. The food was very good as well. I got the Cajun chicken wings and side macaroni salad. It was extremely good and the people working there were very nice! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for good chicken!

mR46nWFYtZBo31h8aMbdWQ.text: I've been hooked on this place for over a year now the service is great and the food is delicious . Chicken shacks is so good makes you wanna slap yo mama !

S2iTimsfT1ksbEKdZZ1Y0g.text: I've passed Chicken Shack many times but have never came close to coming in.  Same center as Ross J's Aloha Grill. It is next to a Smiths and doesn't have a sign that stands out.  So I didn't expect much other than another chicken place.  Was I mistaken.   First thing that caught my eyes were all the various quotes and license plates all over the walls, NICE.  Even saw a license plate from Hawaii that started with a 'K'. I'm 100% sure that a 'K' means it's from Kauai, my home.  They most have known I was coming LOL.  They have 2 flat screen TVs and two arcade games, PAC-MAN and Marvel Super Heros vs Street Fighter.  There wasn't anyone there when I arrived around 2-3pm.  But I just missed the rush, as I was waiting for my food it started to pick up and it was filled.  I ordered the #4 which was 3 wings, 3 fingers, fries and drink for $7.95. LOVED IT.  The wings were good, cant really mess that up.  But the fingers were AWESOME must have been a rhino's fingers, they were plumped, crispy and crunch on the outside, and juicy on the inside. The fries were different, it was prepared like how you would fry calamari and salty but really good, not your regular salt combination.  Something that I've been doing lately and recommend is having the sauce on the side.  My sauce of choice this time was the Hot Teriyaki sauce which was a perfect complement to the saltiness.  I left full but really wanted more.   After talking to one of the worker I found out that Chicken Shack or at least this location has been open for 8 years already. I wished I found this place earlier, especially now that I don't live in the area, this would have been my regular eats.  They have a HH special which is actually all day everyday, its 12 wings, bucket of beers, and a basket of fries for $16. Which might be a good deal.  They also make burgers, sandwiches, and a fried or grilled chicken salad. I'll be back soon definitely.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. #4

NPECn7bcxIPLNpoPrXP38A.text: Went one time and got fried chicken and fries combo. Chicken had a nice crispness but was sooooo salty it was kind of hard to eat. I would go again because I have heard good things, so it's worth giving a try.

TKjz4WqOtPgPVQTGbd6erw.text: Wish I could give 3.5. I work right across the street from this little joint and had to try it on my lunch break. The service was good,  the woman hat took my order was very friendly and knew it was our first time. Prices are a bit high but no too bad. I got the fingers plain with fries, I like to try stuff like this without all the bells and sauces to really get a sense of the food. The fingers were big and hot (temperature), but they weren't very crispy and the actual chicken part was a tad dry. The fry portion was huge and tasty, nice crispy little fries.  I really want to try their wings, sauces sounded good and wings other patrons had looked pretty good. I'll try it again.

nCdxDZz2rkuAJkwzHnYWsA.text: I was just there yesterday order for the whole Fam  best wings ever!!!!! Love the fries too.

MN__SX_nS5514uQMP5RBoA.text: Wings are juicy and crispy without being heavy on grease.   Good sauces. I get the honey habanero.   This location and BC location both excellent on food and customer service.

2JyayFDM9ZKs2JezRenBxg.text: Best chicken in town  bww, wing stop, chick filet all mediocre this is where it's at. So many flavors to pick. Hot BBQ is my shiznit if ur in the area of one stop by!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

xrNNeRM8AsnxUC8UjmGvrg.text: This is a small chicken place that I thought must be worth a try considering I still love a good chicken finger meal.  The shop itself is small but really cute.  I enjoyed the "chicken" sayings that were painted on the walls throughout the shop.  Definitely good for a laugh while waiting for your food.   The shop certainly wasn't clean as a whistle.  But the service was nothing to complain about.    I didn't enjoy my chicken fingers.  Breading was not as crispy as I prefer and the finger itself was just... eh.  I did enjoy the shoestring fries.    It's not exactly the same but while I was there I just kept thinking, "If a Raising Cane's were closer I would have just gone there."    I'd go again and try more stuff but it probably won't come to mind over other lunch joints.

PaI3iaalrhuJkUp4U8FbVg.text: I walked 2 miles up the street from my house to try this place, I went on my daily walk and I ordered three fingers with fries and a drink. They gave me 4 instead of 3, not a complaint there. The chicken is delicious and the fingers are huge portions, they are huge, the fries were ok, very thin but still fries lol. I ate two and was full. Regardless I shared the rest with boyfriend, he liked them too, the sauces are great, lots of variety for sauces, you can pick two with any combo and they are bigger cups. Definitely enough ssauce for your meal. I would say, worth it!

teoxNXQ0E_1_jDNpiKn2KQ.text: Was looking for a chicken place and came across this one so we wanted to try it out. Tried their wings with the suace on the side and man were they nice and crispy!  Got it with the chicken tenders that were just as good. I got the mild sauce so I wasn't too happy because it was kinda spicy for me but i'm a wimp so it's ok but still was good. I loved their shoe string fries too! My bf had the hamburger and he loved it as well. The prices were reasonable. Only downside is that the place is small but other than that I'll come back to try the different sauces!

1wggs_a-aFUJC6MoAjtAMA.text: I had the number Two, five Chicken Fingers and Fries and I got potato salad instead of the fries. Also got the fingers rolled in the buffalo sauce.   Not what I really expected, first of all the the chicken the star of the dish was way over cooked, like it was cooked yesterday and just flashed cooked today, the chicken was tough and chewy.  The buffalo sauce was good and potato salad was very flavorful.  The bottom line chicken was over cooked, chewy and tasted old, possibly freezer burned.  I have them three stars because the last time it was much more fresher then this body, so next time will decide if we ever come back.

bLSdJjzboe4WMzEE7N-nxw.text: Came to try the wing they had great food but amazing service! I've never felt so welcomed! Priscilla was so helpful and not to mention very patient! Hands down the best service I've ever experienced!

M1Zb6ApzSZ426HRV7Zl5sg.text: Good place for chicken fingers. The fries could use some work.. very skinny and greasy and overall seems like a very cheap fry. But as far as the chicken fingers.. pretty good.

WId-bEEhn40P42Xrjpl_8g.text: Loves I am from the mid-south and there is nothing better than finding a place with good wings.  The Chicken Shack is that place that will make you drive across town to get some.  The chicken is full of flavor and I love those straw fries they even have their own unique flavor.  The also have alcoholic beverages with outside seating runaway and try it alone the first time.  Next time bring friends with you enjoy!!!!!

I3F8QUvb8_qUBrO8sQkAow.text: This is a good place to go if you are craving for some chicken and fries. It does get busy and the seats can filled up quickly, leaving you no place to sit and eat.   I normally get the 3 piece chicken tender combo. It comes with fries and a drink. You get to choose one of many flavors sauce they have. You can opt to have it on the chicken or on the side for dipping. I normally get the Jamaican jerk. This time I went with honey habanero. It was more sweet than spicy and didn't have any kick at all. The chicken is moist, cooked well, and has a nice crispy outer layer. The fries here are good! They normally give you more than what you order (I got 4 tenders), but that probably depends on the size of each piece.   The service was okay. The person who helped me seem more interested in her phone than working. She must've looked at her phone at least 5 times while taking my order. After ordering, she asked if I wanted blue cheese or ranch. Not knowing that they charge and thinking it came with it by how she ask me, I went with ranch.   Overall, food is good for chicken and fries. Service could be better and it wasn't even busy when I went. I'll probably come here again.... ONLY if I'm not willing to drive far.

_8ere4-4hM7kM6GVje0evQ.text: Called at 930 pm to place an order. They refused and told me to just "show up". So I did, 8 minutes before closing. Door was locked and I was refused service a second time.   Might not be back to the Shack.

MjEGgnF5no7t4SY_MvjuQA.text: Second review. I don't know what is going on with this place. It used to have the best fingers I could find in town but the quality of food lately has nosedived. Their fingers and fries are constantly coming out scorched and rock hard. On the occasion that the food can be chewed, I end up sick ranging from simple indigestion to food poisoning. I thought that perhaps I had a sensitive stomach but judging from other reviews there seems to be an ongoing problem with this restaurant.

6YTl8j88z0npzLkEuDrgpg.text: I'm all 'bout the "Damn it's Hot" sauce!... whewwww, I'm still feeling the heat, soooooooo good! From previous Yelp pictures, the crispy-crunchy skin looked delish and with my random craving of chicken wings, I decided to give this place a try!   This location is on the smaller size with maybe 6-7 tables and two tables outside. They have some super friendly staff; When I walked in I was greeted with a smile and a "Welcome In." It was the same guy who took my order at the register- again super nice and gave great recommendations on which sauces to try.   Within less than 10 minutes my order was walked out to me and I was on my way... upon first crunch, I knew I was going to really enjoy these wings. That golden glow was mesmerizing and after trying both the Honey Habanero and Damn it's Hot- I knew I was going to be a fan of The Chicken Shack! They serve up some good wings here! I got my wings dry so that I can really feel the crunch of the skin. Plus this way you can control how much sauce you want.   I would definitely return for some more wings in the future and I would recommend this place for friends to try.

EK0G2swi9Qqk1RmGcggT5Q.text: Wooohoooo... Chicken Shack! I no longer eat meat, but I am so in love with Chicken Shack, If I ever fall off my pescatarian journey! I am driving straight to chicken shack. Something about the crispy flavorful piece of white meat chicken (not pork) white meat. Chicken Shack offers so many flavors you can choose from BBQ, Lemon Pepper, Thai Chili so many options, I pick five every-time. I compare the French fries to in and out some think they are great some think they are horriable, and I think they are delicious!! Perfectly salted and ready to be dipped in my barbeque sauce. Lol, that's how I like my fries. Chicken Shake also offers Wings! With bones or without and salads. Great location. Prices run about $8.00ish+

-sB_dPEYt7gsvGIptSLGdw.text: I've been going to this specific location since 2009, when it was known as Chicken Bonz. It's my fav chicken strips/fingers in town, just above Cane's. Then they ended up with 3 Bonz named locations before rebooting with The Chicken Shack. Plus a crap load more locations opened up here and other states.. Glad my patronage helped pay for the expansion. Haha  The fingers are great. I always get the Garlic Parmesan flavor. Their ranch dressing is excellent. Their shoe-string fries are a little too greasy, but very tasty.  The service here is excellent. The dude that takes your order is always super friendly. Food comes out fresh and hot EVERY time.   My only 2 issues is they used to have ayce wings and ayce fingers. Both are long gone. Also they raised prices by about 2 bucks per combo.. but still worth what you pay.

aAW_sYSBWsTL7k4NM8ZpdA.text: DISGUSTING. Found a hair in my chicken wing AND my ranch dressing. Gross! I will never go there again. The quality of the food has been questionable the last couple of times as well.

hiq9Jcm9sMXeyC60mPEK0A.text: My review mysteriously disappeared. Abdul ( guess an owner or main guy) emailed wanting to know when and where my visit was specifically.      You see I ordered a spicy chix sand and a burger during my visit. I phoned in the order and picked it up shortly thereafter. Anyway- was I disappointed in how both sandwiches fell apart and were not put together nicely. It actually was too messy and one bun fell apart altogether. Not a big deal, but worth mentioning on this forum. Well Abdul wanted to know what store, what time, but was never concerned about correcting my disappointing visit- just what employee to address. Take care of your customers if you are so concerned. I never heard from him again and my post ironically disappeared. Not very impressed!

NGL73FzYAISicCnhBbkFaw.text: Great, fast, and friendly service! Wings are great sizes too. Love the many different flavors they have. Definitely a keeper in my book for wings in this area.

7vbxvVOyZJiu2YhbtePaQg.text: IF YOU LIKE DRY CHICKEN this is the place for you! I really wanted to love this place because the staff was really great and I've been looking for a solid chicken joint but...  It is a sin for chicken to be dry and overcooked in such a place. First time, we were excited to try it. First bite, we both looked at each other with that "dog gone it" kind of look. We both knew it was a fail. I got the number 4 - wings, fingers and fries. Wings were breaded which is a crime against humanity. Sauce was ok, but the fingers were dry and overcooked. I ate one wing and one finger and tossed it all. Waste of time and money.  Such a let down. Fries were good. I don't see myself coming back. I mean I knew it wasn't exactly healthy as everything is fried but I at least was hoping for good unhealthy food.

3Eh1bHyk0DnGn9Ar3s-7AQ.text: Definitely the best wings I have had eating out. They have a pretty awesome deal Including wings, fries and a pitcher of beer for like 20 bucks. Highly recommend this place if your looking for solid wings!

kyqRvuJoxfoDzpCS6g2vpA.text: Awesome place. My friends and I got the 4 person deal. We got 25 wings, a gigantic basket of fries, 4 sodas, and 1 lb of potato salad. This is definitely recommended and we will come back to eat the "all you can eat wings".

eugDues0cFhCgpz8Qv3gKw.text: The chicken is really good here, but it is interesting because the thing I like the most is their bacon cheeseburger. I know you might be saying, who gets a burger at a chicken place, but think about it... would a chicken place even be selling a burger if it werent good??? hmmm??? If you are a fan of burgers you got to try it out. It's big. It's good. It will rock your world.

Fki2WFVHInDX2V3jRnTL1g.text: Yummy...omgosh...fries are awesome with mild sauce. The boneless chickens are huge and delicious. Like this place alot. Can't wait for my boyfriend to try and get his input. =]

Vr46mANFVSfdv3Y3ucqmmw.text: The wings are awesome. Nice big meaty breaded wings just like Hooters!!!

kDQwHKA6S6f_dArkPeoglw.text: My friend Mike bragged about what great meaty wings they had and he wasn't lying. Wings were great and staff was warm and friendly.

e4x86n9TMcSJGnKmEEJOhg.text: The wings here at the chicken shack are subpar simply. They are oversized, underseasoned, BREADED (which should be mentioned) and have lackluster sauces!  I believe this restaurant is surviving on the massive portions versus the quality! These wings are by far the worst I have EVER had and I eat wings several times a wing from great places like Wingstop and Wings!  Stear clear of this place or you will be highly upset!

_34oYv_yELoD_rRZj-y1_Q.text: We ordered the chicken wings and fingers.  Tried a few sauces - hot, lemon pepper and habanero honey.  Hot was standard buffalo sauce, lemon pepper was TOO salty and the habanero honey was great (not too sweet with a slight kick at the end).  The hot and habanero honey were sauces but the lemon pepper was a dry rub.  I like my wings and fingers crunchy so next time I will ask for sauce/dry rub on the side.  Chicken was not dry and the portion size was good.  The only negative thing was the cashier made a mistake on my order.  He offered to correct my order, but I would have to pay the difference.  No thanks, it was your mistake buddy.  Overall, the food was good and I liked the decor.  I don't expect mistakes to be made all the time so I think 3 stars is fair but my True rating would be 3.5 stars.

kZa0UoKhrr1Ls_tJppq89w.text: the kids menu was good enough. chicken always good but didn't care for the fries! ranch is good, also had more fingers for me and , side of beans, really yummy and a side of potato salad that was ok. the cashier guy was really friendly and helpful. Notice the back door opened, and well health dep dont like that. I will totally go back and get some other sides

nmE3c2I-HChoyrR10EMFtg.text: Great place to eat. The chicken and fries are amazing and pretty cheap for the amount you get. I am a regular eater here.

OiHpkuiyLemrFqKkTPBA9w.text: I was surprised by this place. It's in a not-so-great location (which makes it a little difficult to find), but they didn't disappoint. The chili lime sauce on chicken strips is great. I always order their sauces on the side, as the chicken is much crunchier (which I like) this way.

5TnbBmFKTZXvTvTZniWESw.text: Some of the best wings in Henderson, and the best take-out wings I've ever had.   They are cooked perfectly and their sauces are delicious. My favorites are the honey habanero, Hot, spicy teriyaki and sweet chili.   Shoe string fries are addictive, how do they make them so good ?!? Dip them in their crack sauce, I mean honey mustard and OMG. I literally have to throw them away to stop eating them. Their coleslaw is also really good.   So why 4 stars?  They charge you for sauce ?! I have never had wings that don't come with Blue cheese ( ranch for the west coasters) on the side. It's annoying is all it is.  No celery and carrots either?! This you also have to pay for. We always pay extra for these things because you're eating wings and these items are necessities. For the cost you would think it would be built into the price.   I would come here more often if it wasn't for the things mentioned above. Other than that, you won't be dissaointed.

NLR50A7WzEeS2RuJOxd9YQ.text: Good wing place.  Small hole in the wall next to smiths.  It's always packed so we like to call in ahead of time.  Wings are huge and they are breaded then fried, very filling.  We normally get the extra hot wings, jerk, and the mango habanero.  Honestly the place could use a good scrubbing and cleaning.  It's a little run down and dirty... but service is always good and it's always tasty. Lol

YnTkkQbVdgYhBLWV019v9g.text: Had my eye on this place and was happy when I had a chance to sample it's delights.  Upon entry I noticed the it is close quarters ordering and eating.  I suggest either an early or a late lunch.  This place gets busy!  And rightfully so I might add.  I ordered up five tenders and fries with a sweet tea.  Some tenders were coated with habanero honey and some were dusted with the garlic parmesan seasoning.  For dipping I chose both ranch and bleu cheese.  Fully expecting the habanero to hurt me, it did not and was not overpowering but offering a very nice spicy/sweet taste.  I did not notice the parmagarlic rub to much.  No matter, the chicken was moist and tasty.   FYI...They serve beer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

EiPQVgjciLSIFxcHNjkWzQ.text: GREAT wings.  Big and greasy and juicy.  An order of six wings, fries and a drink could easily feed two.  A new favorite when funds are low and we are visiting.

xkbSJ4DnOipg2Ah5SRdYpg.text: This used to be our favorite place to get our yummy chicken wing and fries fix! But now not anymore..the person that they have up front is so terrible! No personality,her attitude totally suck,and has noo customer service..thank goodness for the new location as we from now on going to that one annd its closer to the house...I gave it 1 star but thats for the service,the food is still yummy!

j_VPSuMUjgUpi81C03beNQ.text: This was my first time eating here tonight! I read other reviews that complained about the size of the place, and it is small, but it's called My Chicken Shack, not My Chicken Palace. The name suits the size.   It was busy when I went tonight, but not too cramped and they definitely had a good amount of tables for groups to sit at. I waited maybe 5 minutes in line before I ordered; they had only one register from what I could see. There were a lot funny phrases playing with the "Why did the chicken cross the road?" question all around on the walls though that entertained me while I waited to order.   When I reached the counter, the worker was friendly and provided recommendations of popular sauces to have for my wings. There are definitely a lot of options to suit everyone's preference. I ended up ordering 6 of his recommended Honey BBQ and 6 of my personal choice of Medium. The Honey BBQ was good! I could have done without the Medium though, it was whatever.   I ordered the 10 piece chicken fingers with Chipotle BBQ sauce for my boyfriend and was asked if this order was for one person. When I said yes, I was warned about the size of the chicken fingers and that it might be too much for just one person. I decided to stick with it but.. damn, he was right! Those things are huge!!! I thought the fingers were better than the wings too, honestly.   They only have one size option for drinks too, and it's probably the equivalent to most places' small size. I didn't dine in but it looked like you could have unlimited refills, at least.   I had high expectations for this place considering how busy it always looks from the outside. I'm not sure these expectations were met, though. It was good - don't get me wrong - but I was expecting it to be the most amazing chicken I have ever had and I think my hopes were a bit too high.   Rating is really a 3.5 but giving them the benefit of a 4. I would go back, but only now and then.

6-eab5QfLMW5WF3ik5t_DQ.text: I love this place. The chicken is always juicy and done to perfection and the fries are always hot! The Boulder City location is great too and so is Valle Verde. The new location on St Rose needs more than a little help, but I'm sure it'll soon come up to the standard of the rest!

ku0OcXlDuJjkKofFRAoFug.text: Great service but the taste is lacking a little.   It's located in the huge galaxy theater plaza and can be very easy to miss. The vibe of the place is pretty cool. The cook and the cashier are on top of everything and they run it efficiently. It's a small place, and at peak hours you can expect to wait for a table. Prices are average.  I ended up getting the five piece chicken finger in the lemon pepper, tasted okay but nothing stellar. I think you'd be better off getting some of the more wet sauces such as honey bbq.

A_MdSeMkaOPYDzsFCwdOpA.text: This place is GREAT!!! Chicken Shack has very friendly service and the food is good too. Also, the sauces were amazing!! I will be going back for sure. #FiveStars

Rjgz2lSttyXZF5nb7SnqNA.text: Chicken Shack is a fantastic go-to for good chicken. The portions are generous and the chicken has always been tender and juicy. The chicken is slightly salted for flavor and I'm not sure if I could pick up on any seasoning, but the chicken is delicious nonetheless.  You have the option of getting a combination of chicken fingers, chicken wings, and/or fries. They had a wide array of dipping sauces, all of which are good when paired with the chicken and fries. I either get the 10 piece chicken fingers for $12.29 or the 5 piece chicken fingers, fries, and drink for $8.99. I usually get the habanero honey and honey mustard sauces. I've heard the garlic parmesan and lemon pepper are good sauces too.  The service is quick and there is not wait staff, so you have to get everything yourself if your forget it at the counter.  It's a very straightforward and simple restaurant, just chicken and fries, nothing else. If you're looking for a good chicken, check out Chicken Shack!

gBLIu6y6orSNvBHsQB0RxQ.text: Just happened to be on this side of town and it was about dinner time. I remembered this place from a couple years ago when I met up with a friend here. I liked their hole-in-the-wall location and atmosphere. It seems very little has changed since my last visit. Their place is located in an older strip mall. When I got there it was about 7:00 pm and the place was busy but not crowded. I ordered the five piece chicken strips along with the creamy parmesan and I believe it was the hot honey garlic sauce, both on the side. One side of sauce was enough, actually, to handle all five strips. Shoestring fries and fountain drink completed my order. The chicken strips I received were cooked to a darker golden brown (which made the outside more crunchy) but the chicken itself was tender and juicy, and hot off the fryer. I needed to wait a couple minutes by eating the fries first. The staff was friendly and helpful enough. Although *I* have had no issues, I would side with a few other reviewers and recommend coming during their peak hours. Yes, it will be busier but I also believe this is when they cook and serve their best food. I would be cautious of coming in close to closing time because orders may be cooked inconsistently.

QokIYHFoUkr9V2QV1RSB-w.text: Went in today, saw they had chilli asked about it. The fucktard said "I don't know" well that was it!!!  I don't recommend this place, customer service is a fkn joke, place was dead, and dirty!!! I don't feel one star is deserved!!!

k4zKxU1HkHSvH_g5Wy0lvg.text: Ok, first off, the food is great! The chicken wings were really good, the sauce is tasty, and the fries are CRAZY GOOD! My only complaint is with the service.  They advertise being open until 9pm. My wife and I showed up October 31st @ 5:50pm and were told that they were closing in 10 minutes, so we would have to eat outside.  We agreed to this and then proceeded to watch multiple people get turned away, even though the open light was still on and the door was unlocked.  We could hear the employees talking about some Halloween party that they were wanting to go to, and it made us wonder if they were really supposed to be closing early, or if they were just taking advantage of the boss being away.  There was a sign on the door that asked patrons not to wear masks inside the store for Halloween which made us believe even more that this was not something that the owners were aware of. We sat outside for about an hour and watched numerous groups get turned away because the "fryer was already turned off" as the cashier would tell people, and then proceed to take the orders groups of 1 or 2. One lady who was turned away, was pretty upset, and she was talking to her husband, complaining about them supposedly closing, but saying that she overheard the people in the back talking about their Halloween party. Then another group that was turned away, said that they thought it was ridiculous that they were closing @ 6:30pm. I overheard them and said, "That's funny, they told us 6!" Another group was turned away shortly thereafter being told that the fryer was already turned off. Not 2 minutes later, a man and his wife walked in, ordered their food, and continued to eat their meal, inside. Some people were forced to eat in their cars, because there was no room @ the tables outside, and the staff kept telling people that they had to leave. The cashier came to the door as we were eating, and started to peel the sign off of the door, notifying customer about their mask policy. He looked over at me and said, "I probably should lock the door huh?" I said, "Probably, unless you want more angry customers than you've already had so far tonight." My wife asked him if the owners were aware of their early closing, which he skirted the question by saying that it was a family run business that closes early for holidays, like Thanks Giving and Halloween.  I told him that this was the first business I've ever heard of that closes early for Halloween and he just kind of nervously chuckled and said, "Yeah" and then I told him that it might not be a bad Idea to turn off the Open sign, or put up a sign notifying customers of their change in business hours. My guess is that this was just a bunch of idiots, thinking that they were pulling a fast one, by coming up with a "genius" plan to close up shop early, so they could get to a partly. I know that I won't be going back, the next time I am in Vegas.

T8U5tJiOkRuNRan4XFqRJQ.text: Love this place great staff and food. The only reason I give it 4 instead of 5 is its just so small and crowded and when it's busy that line takes forever to move being only one register, however food always comes out rather fast.

MAR4CK6VBZDry2YMhvb4mQ.text: I don't know if it was the heat of the moment when I had my first bite, but in my opinion, this beats Buffalo Wild Wings and Wingstop. That's means a lot coming from me especially since I love eating chicken wings haha.  Nice little hole-in-the-wall location right in the Smith's shopping center. Place is a little small to eat at during the lunch rush, so I recommend just taking your order to-go.   My favorite sauces to order are creamy garlic parmesan and creamy hot bbq. So delicious! I feel like it's almost a guilty pleasure. Overall, good food and good vibes.

kO6yVCKhks4WsIdKmP-QUA.text: Always great food! Fingers tender, wings delicious. Staff friendly and nice. Great local place to come especially on our way to the movies.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

VpqgCkayBKWofwhDX9eSGg.text: Chicken Shack is a top-3 restaurant in Henderson for me. I work across the street and regularly walk to eat here for lunch. Their chicken tenders are the best I've had in Henderson, and their skinny fries are the perfectly crispy complement to the tenders. The best part of eating here is the occasional 4th tender they give you when you order a 3-piece meal. They have great sauces, and one of my favorite requests is to have the tenders thrown in medium sauce. For the days when you need a somewhat healthier meal, their grilled chicken salad is filling and somewhat satisfying. The only issue with eating at chicken shack is the limited seating.

u_g4vSfjiDJyes3bxY3QSw.text: This place is awesome!! I loved Canes until I started eating here!!! The best chicken tenders and wings ever!! The homemade ranch is the best in town!! The fries and baked beans are super yummy!! Try it, you won't be sorry!!

CCrp4s1ZKZuIvoRX5SkGDg.text: Recently reviewed this restaurant which I love! Fast food and friendly service. Had to come back with an updated picture of my favorite. The 6 piece of wings and fries tossed in hot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. #1- 6 piece wings, fries, and a drink

VsQVtbvBUMs135qpMpVxZQ.text: Tried it for lunch next to my work. Decent normal tasting chicken strips, nothing out of the ordinary or spectacular. The spicy sauce was good. Food came out fast too.  Might come back to try their fries or other sauces too.

fLQsEW_c743Kp_2A8FpM1g.text: Food is fresh and flavorful. Service is fast and friendly. I only wish they were a drive through... but no one is perfect, haha! Their ranch dressing is amazing. Yum-o!

w05OEdKD-18TpeQGQRykCA.text: One word....DELICIOUS!! I showed up to the restaurant around 6 PM and the place was fully crowded. I knew that was a good sign. I am glad I called in my order because they were packed! The chicken was juicy and crispy and the chili cheese fries were amazing. Can't wait to come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. 5 piece combo with sauce on the side and chili cheese fries...mmmmmm!!

qCF4LtzY3f1JUMiU5lFmqA.text: Rothman S.'s review is so accurate!   I went to this place based on the recommendation of a co-worker and I prefer to support independents.    It's noon/lunch hour and I can not imagine placing a less welcoming person at the register/order station. NOT A HINT of a smile came across that woman's face and the entire time she was taking my order she had her blue eyes starring out the window. NO LIE; I looked behind me to see what was in the parking lot that was so damn captivating.  I must admit she did make eye contact one time; when I handed her my twenty bucks.    There was no one tending/cleaning the empty tables, so if you came after me; enjoy the crumbs & spilled sauce!   I have an idea, put Ms. Personality on busboy duty and allow customers to yell their order to the cook in the kitchen!  She'd be less appalling and the next customer wouldn't have stains on the elbows of their long sleeve shirt!   I end this by stating my opinion about the food because that's all that really matters, right?  Simply; the chicken was consistent with the service.  F

D22tRPkcjr7qVtHrufO_ug.text: So after everybody claiming this place is great, I finally went and boy was I disappointed. The chicken was chewy and greasy. The sauces were not good. The ranch dressing was though. The fries were disgusting, oily and cold.  We also purchased wings and those were nasty as well. Don't do what I did and believed people that this place was so great and then expect great, because you will want to slap yourself for believing this. People are easily impressed with anything they don't cook. Maybe that's the problem, they should cook.   Don't waste your money. To top it off it is pretty expensive for the quality of food. Don't do it.  Unless you like wasting money.  :)

3dVgl8BzrwlQukxVxJ8NFw.text: I love chicken shack. I thought I had already written a review. I lived in Vegas worked on Henderson. I would eat here often. I've left but my In-laws still live in Henderson so every visit I eat here at least once. Some of the best wings. It's one of the places  in Henderson. Please stop by this place. You will not regret it.

Kr8HTzfQ2VVw0l4-E2C0MQ.text: Called ahead and ordered to go around 7:30pm. Once driving, I opened the box to grab some fries and noticed order was missing 2 tenders (5 pc order), & so i circled back to get rest of order. *not a huge deal, but definitely inconvenient*  The big issue here is that upon opening the lid of the box there immediately was a very foul and overbearing smell which reeked of rubber/old dirty oil. I mentioned this to the staff and was told, "it's fried so its going to smell and taste like oil". I left, as I was in a hurry and figured once I dunk it in hot sauce and ranch it wouldn't be bad.   While driving, I took a bite and dipped the chicken into the buffalo sauce yet had the worse taste of butt/oil in my mouth.  After looking at them in the light closer, the chicken fingers were drenched and coated with a greasy/slime residue of oil and very soggy. The fries, unfortunately, were exactly the same and tasted like pure oil. I immediately lost my appetite. After only having a few bites of a chicken tender and a few fries my stomach soon after began to reject the food and  I had to pull over and puke.   I have eaten here several other times and the quality of food and way of which it was prepared has never been an issue. Not sure if maybe they had new cooks, if they hadn't cleaned out fryer properly (using old dirty oil), or if they just got lazy due to being later in night. Regardless, this should never of been an issue and it was a waste of my time, money, and messed my stomach up for the night.  I hate that I wrote a review only after having a bad experience as I've enjoyed chicken shack before, and for that reason alone I will give a 2 star rating. However, after eating/throwing up what was clearly food that was not prepared correctly and not suitable to eat, I doubt I will ever return here again or reccomend this establishment going foward.  Side note: good prices on beer and good location.

0mdATlzp6QU1yksNEPOGdw.text: Great temperature great flavor great value!  The best skinny fresh tasty French fries ever. The spicy chipotle wings is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

Db07eLD_2hbJ9t0j1cJQiw.text: I love the food here! the first time I came here there was a kind young gentleman that assisted us at the register and his hospitality alone made me recommend this spot to all my friends and family. I returned again on Labor Day and the lady that is mentioned numerous times on their Yelp page helped me. she is completely rude but had no problem sucking the tv reporters butt that was in their establishment. because of her attitude I don't think I can support this eatery any more. way to make your customers feel like shit

ljD6aj74byEjPVJ62GHEUA.text: This place was alright. We were incredibly hungover and cruising around town when we spotted this place. Food was greasy and the tables were dirty but I was in no position to be picky.  The food did its job. Soaked up all that Fat Tuesday  Nothing I would go out of my way for. Meh

uVv6XAGcJm4LWFZpFkjPWg.text: so I think they need to change the oil more frequently.....my last 3 times the chicken has been burnt due to bad grease. Not sure what's going on with them never had this problem until lately.  Very disappointed

-7es8Ug2P9uWbpCEVa3llA.text: First of all, it is relatively expensive for what it is.  Family of 4, 2 adults and 2 children under 10, $40.  That seems a bit much imo.    I got a chicken mozzarella wrap with the cucumber salad.  $10 w/o a drink.  Wrap was actually very good, cucumber salad was a bowl of cucumbers with straight, potent apple cider vinegar poured on it.  Way to strong a vinegar flavor to be edible.    My wife got a chicken Caesar wrap with Mac and cheese. Wasn't very impressed.    Friends that met us here got a chicken meal with mashed potatoes.  Chicken wasn't bad, potatoes weren't impressive.   Drink dispenser sprays soda all over your wrist.    Brought the wrong order to our table and weren't very friendly when we brought it back to them.  They replaced it, but didn't really say sorry or anything or even speak to us about it. They looked mad at their staff, took the wrong stuff away and didn't say anything.  I stood there for a bit and then told them, "I guess I'll go sit back down and wait for it." and they didn't reply.   Simply, it wasn't overly impressive for $40.  Won't be returning

WGk68Wft5uV-grdGObep3w.text: Amazing fried chicken sandwich and fries. So glad I tried this place. It beats a burger any day Looking forward to my next meal in town.

Oprqnyu0AomtbknDWfGDZg.text: First time tip: ask for the sauce on the side - wings perfect as they are, undressed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

fBYAHrYFQH-IDgGREKFs-Q.text: The food is REALLY good bu just a bit too greasy ... i had to pat my chicken and fries with a napkin to get most of the grease off . Also they made me pay .60 cents for ranch and i never got the ranch and ask multiple times . Wasn't happy about that . It's only .60 cents but it's just the point . Other than that pretty good food

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

6ZRQa-Q7IZbKA5jyJe44jg.text: This is possibly one of the nastiest wing places I've ever been to in my entire life I tried a different location the first time which was also gross so I decided to give another location a chance...EPIC FAIL! Food is super bland, and dry...if you can mess up wings, you just shouldn't cook anything period. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT AND WASTE OF MONEY!

Klr51iGAeNs6R517ZAZmXg.text: How do I describe the Shack ... hmmmmmm.  Of all the locations, this is the best (speaking of which, they are opening on on Rainbow & Tropicana!  Finally, movin' on up to the West Side).     Chicken is a little salty and greasy at times - BUT, staff is friendly and the chicken is juicy and yummy.  Habanero Honey Sauce - oh and don't forget the Fry Sauce.

f4zfMeSPsIln1-sc4ypYfQ.text: Everytime I drive by here, there are people. Roberto's next door might be empty,  but the Chicken Shack has people there.....why? What is it about this place?  Well, finally decided to go in an check it out on a Monday night around 8pm. A couple TV's with some sports on. They serve beer. OK, I'm beginning to understand the appeal. Wings, chicken strips, burgers, chicken sandwiches, fries, and a few other sides. Simple menu.  I got a 12 wing pack, creamy garlic parmesan and Damn Hot! split. $11.99 or a dollar a wing. Wings are big, so decent enough pricing. At a glance I thought the sides prices were a bit high, but I didn't see the quantity served.   I wasn't overwhelmed with the creamy garlic parmesan wings, I have had better at dive bars. Not bad, just not great. My friend said the Damn Hot! wings weren't that hot. I didn't try them so no comment.  Its an ok place, mostly frequented by younger people. I'll probably stop by again sometime but I wouldn't go out of my way. Usually I bbq my own wings. 3 stars fits the bill.

ukVxdVd7TM7G9TveAQWoXQ.text: BEST CHICKEN EVER.  My family and I eat here at least twice a month. I'm addicted to the Damn hot sauce!! They are always very polite and also very quick. Will definitely be back!

QTsYdhMpmpGHFkAqKGLBjA.text: Fucking excellent! This chicken is fucking delicious! So Crispy and no grisly pieces!!! The guy at the counter totally help with anything I needed, this was my first time here and felt so welcome as he helped me decide what I wanted. I'll definitely be back!

tPxmpyjxd8utdvf7ZCX5NQ.text: I always love coming here because the food is so awesome. Today I had an extra special experience. Eddie was the cashier and he is great. He has such a fun and positive attitude. We all know no one likes to work but he seemed to be genuinely happy to be there & it made me want to come back. Way to go Chicken Shack and way to go Eddie!!

Gf5FjaXgQahqTjNPl21WtQ.text: This place is AMAZING. the only reason it gets 4 instead of 5 is because the place is super small, and when it's busy sometimes all the tables are full. I love their fingers and fries! Everything is cooked fresh and hot, and their sauces are amazing too. They have so many different types to choose from. My favorite is the chili lime sauce and regular hot sauce. The service was great too, they called us by name, and every employee had a smile on their face. Definitely returning.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. So fresh!!! Amazing flavor
Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Amazing fingers and fries

Ewz_hq8daQYJ-ZHiQRpGbQ.text: Visiting Las Vegas for a basketball tournament with my boyfriend and his team! We came here and it was amazing! I was not disappointed. My boyfriend and i both got the chicken sandwich with bacon! The sand which was made up of 3 large chicken strips! A large amount of food & For both meals, fries & two sodas + a small tip it was less that 23$ in total. The gentleman at the register was amazing with customer service. He acknowledged that we had never been here and was great at recommending options. Although it was a little messy from the rush and the tabletops were a little sticky... my overall experience here was good! Great food and customer service! I definitely enjoyed my visit. Would recommend to others & come back!

IG8PjMlr9V4FggzDP7yp3A.text: I decided to go here for lunch because my coworkers encouraged me to because they are familiar with the establishment. The owners do business with my company so my peers frequent there. HOWEVER, my experience was not good at all. The owner Melissa was very curt and  unengaging to say the least. I was not greeted at all, almost like I was disturbing the convo she was having with her husband.  I place my order and she asked what kind of sauce I wanted and I asked her what were my options she motioned with her head toward the menu....... the rest of the interaction was very rushed, mind you I was the only customer there until I finished placing my order and a 4 kids came in and were greeted almost immediately! Needless to say I will not patronize a business that doesn't respect and treat all customers the same. Customer service shouldn't be selective......

bivgUkfeLZD8NeWRP-2MOg.text: This place has the best chicken wings in the USA! I always get the lemon pepper dry rub with a few sauces and eat them until I'm miserable! Huge chicken wings, fast service, consistent, and damn good taste!

rn5bKfThTOHaAd4_25Df7g.text: Best chicken and great service!  Always better to call in order for even quicker check out!  I always get the honey BBQ wings, but my son loves the mild chicken fingers.  The ranch is the best too!!!

0ALfstAY4FpauhYI7WR86A.text: My husband brought home some wings and tenders with hot honey garlic sauce and fries. It was so yummy! Can't wait to go back

1orOS25hTT3vu9311Qx0qg.text: We love the tenders and the salty fries. It's the sauces that make it 5 stars for our family.   It would be great if they power washed the outdoor tables. They are grilled and so can't be wiped clean.

zKcFgBSjYzoPweUpzc8I8w.text: Thanks to Bethany E. for turning me on to Chicken Shack. To my surprise after I checked in and was seated Bethany came over and introduced herself. It was a pleasure to meet you finally Bethany!  It was the lunch hour and Chicken Shack was rockin although I had no problem finding convenient parking. I opted for the six wing combo which included shoe string fries and a beverage. Service is prompt - within minutes my entree was brought to my table and I was taken back of the size of  the chicken pieces served. I chose chipotle sauce on the side which was tasty and the fries were also yummy. The portions are generous here and I couldn't finish all  the fries.  I would definitely return to the Chicken Shack.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy ranch today!

p0TAWfDa_TXyC9Bt6Y3amQ.text: Good salty food Dirty sticky tables A bone and a hair in my chili, beware Trash overflowing  Fries and chicken are as good as I remembered however, seems like this place is going downhill.

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Good salty food A bone and a hair in my chili, beware Dirty sticky table

y5upxgmsBiN4YBBMF5VIIQ.text: My husband was picking all our stops today, and he loves this place...I however, was underwhelmed.  -Service was friendly -food came out FAST -chicken fingers were good  -several sauce options   -didn't care for the fries, just a personal preference  -coleslaw tasted a little fermented  If he wants to bring me here again I would probably just order the chicken by itself. Good place to get a party platter from - I think the chicken would be awesome in a wrap.

Kd-1cC6030XdOshFS6yVFA.text: The chicken here is great (much bigger and tastier then raising canes) they have such a big selection of sauces, I'm a big fan of the Honey BBQ and the Cajun. I work nearby so I usually come here once a week and even though they can get pretty busy during the lunch hour, they have the food  ready super fast.

KdKQh_bSo6lqaOtbwSKrAA.text: My son and I normally love this place and always come when we are in Henderson. Yesterday I wanted to take some out of town guest to try it out because they live so close, but unfortunately the wing we're horrible this time. They tasted as if they were precooked and heated to serve. I felt bad for bringing the guest because normally we have a great experience. I hope this was just a one time issue because my son loves this place and would like to return. I appreciate fast service but if that doesn't mean my wings are cooked to order than I don't mind waiting longer to have good fresh food.

lu__L2asG1XbFhd0JKGTsQ.text: Chicken is pretty much my favorite food you name it Jack in the box McDonald's Wendy's I've tried all of it  When I tried canes when I was About 13 I never thought nobody can top that  I found something that did top it and it's chicken shack  It's the best place to grab chicken they give you massive amounts and usually throw in extra and you can get toppings like garlic parm or mild ETC  I usually get #2(5 piece) with garlic parm with garlic parm on the fries it can't get much better than that

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken shack with garlic parm and GP on fries

nV9uKKhxAcgboCMYeeyvTg.text: Have to keep it short and sweet.  Best size wings in town..  I had about 3-4 of them and got full!  I'd recommend to others!

CbozP8eZQN8FGZHVtfMrsg.text: In my opinion, BETTER than Canes! Only we need one on the opposite side of town!

xq5-tG6pC0Fm1vRFXuVoUw.text: Hard to mess up chicken fingers, right? I agree. The shitty gas station tenders can be pretty damn good in a pinch. But this place?! Man, this place does it right.   The fingers are perfectly HOT when they come out and the inside remain juicy while they are nice and crispy on the outside.   The variety of sauces really makes it so I don't get sick of the place. You can always find a new combo.   On days I don't feel like fries with them, they happily sub a different side.   And, to warm the dark cackles of my heart, they offer both ranch AND blue cheese as dipping sauce.  No, the staff isn't the most warm and fuzzy and happy group. But this isn't  a Guy Savoy fine dining experience-all I care about is getting my fingers fast, hot, and crispy. And that they do.

e1xnmeStm-1uMe6VH2lP7g.text: I LOVE CHICKEN SHACK! And I love it even more because it is so close to my house. I have only ordered their wings (honey habanero are my favorite, but all of the flavors are excellent) because they are just too good to pass up on every time I go in. Sauces are unique and do not taste like any other wing place in town. Strongly recommend!

nal2gzEETU0f8BHbtEJAkQ.text: Might be the best wings in town!!! Don't let the looks fool you. Yes it's a small greasy kind of a hole in the wall chicken shop, but it's good!!! Kind of place that the smell is in your clothes when you leave. Flavors are all right on, chicken is non-greasy and crispy. They even have PBR on tap. Garlic parm is my fav!!!

KUaZHB0wqKkRuMGcvEoDeQ.text: One of my favorite quick stops. 10 minutes and I am on my way with 20 chicken tenders that are awesome with there sauces.  And not to mention the large french fries come in a huge box.

L7o_U2-1WVpiB5EailBUTQ.text: I just came back from out of the country and honestly, I couldn't wait to come back to Vegas just so I can stop by one of my favorite places in the city.   By far, the best fried chicken (both wings and strips) I've had.  Tried a couple of other places and it just doesn't compare: the flavors, the texture, the size... Mmmmm-mmmm!!!! (smacking my lips)  What also gives it the edge are the shoestring french fry combination, it brings out that crunch that I had been looking for at the other chicken wings/strip spots.  The serving size is huge, I usually split a combo with a friend and that tends to be enough for me.  For those with larger appetites, don't worry, this place won't disappoint.  BIG Thumbs up!  The service is great, everyone there are friendly. Cute little spot that gets busy with a diverse crowd of patrons. The only complaint I have is during the times I've dined in, I can't help but notice how dirty the place is (the walls are friggin' gross as it's covered with dust and grease). As much as I enjoy the food when I dine there, the walls can be distracting.  Other than that, this place has great food (5 stars) and great service (5 stars)... just wish it was a bit more tidy (3.0). Overall, 4.3 stars in my book

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States

Gi3CffRlMGxOeTmTb2j9cQ.text: Very delicious...very friendly staff and the garlic parmesean chicken fingers are to do for!

3OHUuslK0LpxngCGZC2Zgw.text: I love Chicken Shack! The chicken and fries are delicious. My husband and I have ordered a regular/large fry and usually (I forget the exact amount) 8-10 tenders to share and it was plenty. We have been here twice, and I am a fan. The only thing is both times the service was ok. I felt like an outsider intruding or bothering the workers. If I asked a question I was kind of given a quick short answer like I should already know all this and be ready to go. I had to laugh but agree on the other reviewers comments of "dont ask for a water cup!" I legitimately drink water some times with my meals.

ERj0VQn26os6ErTLdIq9Rw.text: Not impressed... The wings are WAY to greasy and chicken strips are too dry. I've been here twice, hoping I'll feel differently the next time around but no... A selection of sauces is nice but the wing and strips are lacking. As you bite in, you taste old oil, ew.

FRHG1bDCl2l-0cDA_Pns3w.text: Talk about some amazing chicken wings, this place has it!  We had the medium, hot and honey habanero and all were out of this world! The wings were cooked to perfection the staff was excellent and the fries are just like I like them. The home made dips were also all very good! I would give it five stars if it was a five star type of place, but this is as good as it gets in dining like this! Next time I am going to try the extra hot as I like things very spicy, and the normal hot wasn't super hot. Also the hone habanero isn't very spicy but is sweet and spicy and very good. Also the garlic parmesan is outstanding, but in wings I do like spicy.

U6xIvp0Iu5q2-Y3lR8SJfQ.text: Phone order your food ahead of time.. The batter they use for the wings here are amazing!

6ifSzJUK85NYfkvSUxyDaA.text: Best chicken in the valley!!! Killing wingstop in many ways too! Used to visit twice a week when I lived nearby. Variety of sauces you can choose from: garlic parm, spicy BBQ, habanero, jerk, original hot, etc..... Great place for watching sports too!  The only issue is that they charge for ranch, blue cheese. I feel like it should be included with wings but I don't mind paying cuz i needs my ranch! Would recommend anyone looking for quality chicken!

McYfJvaVvZNoDVzhlW1ODw.text: Nice location... Service was good but nothing major. From the look and smell of the garlic parmesan wings I was expecting greatness!! The crunch and seasoning on the wing is excellent! However, one bite of the chicken and you wonder what happened. There is no flavor in the actual chicken... Such a sad find. It doesn't take much to season chicken... If they did that it would put them above the national franchise. The fries are cut thinner then most places but are so good! My disappointment comes when the signature item lacks flavor. I'd eat there again but I will definitely be trying something else.

IhFUIkJBxwXr3iZ_bItrPQ.text: I looove their fries! I'm a shoestring fry kinda girl. I got the garlic parmesan wings and they were pretty good. Not much to complain about.. good price, good food. Just the woman working the counter seemed a little bit too busy and didn't provide such great customer service. Everything else was good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Chicken Shack - Henderson, NV, United States. Garlic parmesan wings combo

UZGDG6zvfrE7unXzZjCexg.text: I love this place.  The chicken is so good that you don't even need sauce but you want it!  Every sauce I have tried is good but I love the medium!  Lemon pepper rub is also good.  Portions are really good sized and most times when I ask for extra fingers, they give me more than I ask for for free!  The fingers are the way to go although you also can't go wrong with the wings.  Better than canes or any other chicken place around.

Jwl86NWcgque6OorDQcgHg.text: Wow! It should be called CheapSkate Shack! We are obviously regulars here (ashamed to say Dukedom) and they wouldn't let us have a water cup...basically accusing us of trying to steal soda. My daughter drinks water or soda. If she wanted soda today, we would have bought a soda like all the other times before. But to hassle regular customers about a stupid water cup is RIDICULOUS!!  Being the greasy dive you are CS, you will attract the less than savory crowd who take advantage of water cup privileges. Solve the problem without insulting your regular paying clientele! Also from the lack of cleanliness in your dining area...you could do for a health inspection.

9yh12igD2P2W32j2IdtrKQ.text: I do love me some chicken shack.   This place has some really great fried chicken, but what sets them apart is their expansive sauce selection. My personal favorite being the honey bbq and hot bbq. Their fries are also just amazing.   My only one complaint is that the chicken isnt always consistent. At times their chicken can be very chewy, and not so easy to eat. I would say I experience this about  one out every three or four visits. Thus why I have not been dining there as much lately.   When their chicken is good its a 5 star place, but with the inconsistency I can only give them 4.

bqYakKHwsDyVBA0LExQZZg.text: Come early or be patient because the food is good. The fries are crisp and the chicken is hot and tasty. It's a small place so be prepared to say excuse me and smile a lot. Don't be afraid to share a table. Of the table is dirty, it's because the lunch tables turn quick. You'll leave full and satisfied.

HJzk0cOl9bSGgnSY4Tmu-Q.text: Meh tasting. I got 10 chicken tenders and the happy hour special with hot wings. Chicken was crispy on the outside and moist inside but not flavorful and very greasy. The grease in my stomach and intense thirst woke me and my friend up in the middle of the night! The fries are skinny but plentiful. Generous portions (we couldn't finish between 3 hungry people), cheap beer and nice staff though!

iUp1n3d24Phy3FXZQx-Akw.text: I really loved the French Fries. Very thin and crispy.  My husband and children got wings and we got an order of fingers. The fingers didn't get eaten like I thought they would but everyone loved the wings. Next time I'll just get way more fries and pass on the fingers.  The place was pretty busy ( which I consider to be a good sign). It took about 15-20 for my Togo order to be ready.

DDqFLkIVv2dD8HPqDqYneA.text: Really some of the best wings I've ever had. Their batter is crisp and thick without being unnecessarily greasy. I had 6 wings smothered in honey bbq and dipped the other 6 in bleu cheese dressing.  Their wings are pretty huge too so get a bunch but don't be afraid to share! the staff is also super nice

ZFUJ9DYmWLwIJPM86nH0EQ.text: Love love this place! Excellent chicken and service..we are regulars and love garlic parmesan and honey bbq. The chicken is juicy and tender

GXA9Kp54pfNEgaNmSqRFEw.text: I came in earlier today with a friend of mine to catch up really quick on old times. It had to be a quick meet up because she was on a half hour lunch break. We picked Chicken Shack because it was close to her job and from all of word of mouth advertising made me really want to try out this place. I ordered a five strip meal with fries and selected spicy blue cheese and honey habanero sauce on the side. Few minutes later, my both mine and my friends food came out rather quickly with a clean and concise presentation. Eating the food, I can tell that they use quality products and they pay attention to detail with cooking. Nothing was skimped on and the sizes of everything were proportionate. I found myself really enjoying the food, however my eyes were bigger than my stomach. When I went up to the counter, the gentleman working at the counter already knew I needed a to go box without asking. So I can honestly say I will be back here. Clean place, great food, and friendly staff. Count on me coming back and recommending all of my friends to eat here!

qnirRFt4lZ3TD-9vzcvxeQ.text: So we had ordered 12 wings. It took them less than ten mins and there it was for us. Who would've known she would go home from work as she could not stop hurling and having diarrhea.  Will be in contact with the health department soon as they should look at proper techniques to cook safely.

YPWZ7MtxzO61obpI6TWfqg.text: YUM!  Real chicken breast - delicious.  Chili cheese fries and baked beans were also great. Good size portions and decent price.  Will definitely come back.  Bonus - in the same shopping center as Galaxy theaters.

fThuZDJwuIqKQ832MZ6bGQ.text: I would give this place a 5 star review if they didn't use Postmates as their delivery service. I was able to make ONE single successful order though postmates but since that order, my cart will not clear. Because of that, I cannot make another order for delivery. I have tried emailing postmates a few times now and even called them. Each time, they give me the same useless solution. Uninstall/reinstall the app or click "edit". It still won't allow me to place another order. If Chicken Shack began delivering or changed their delivery service like EAT24 or BiteSquad,  which work flawlessly, I won't be able to eat there as often as I would like. This is the only negative. Their food is amazing and I wish I could have it delivered.... :-(

92f_q4wnNKRL7lHWmuzS-w.text: Great Quality Chicken Strips!!! They have a great selection of dipping sauces that can be drizzled over top or on the side for dipping. The batter is light and salty and the chicken is 100% breast meat. Very tender. The prices are reasonable and there is a sauce for everyone. For an alternative to "Fast Food" that is a bit more healthy than the chain stores give Chicken Shack a try. I prefer them to Canes.  We were told the name change occurred when the original Chicken Bonz owners wanted to increase margin with frozen chicken and lower cost recipes and preparation.   Regardless of the name Chicken Shack is a solid pick for some Good Fried Chicken in Las Vegas.

iV_YdJyN2wQNgpccR4q-2g.text: I'm a native from California but my grandma stays down the street and she loves to eat here. we just got a lot of chicken and I must say it was pretty good big pieces and I will be visiting soon!

9UrjOzkM6E_EVxvx_BmQjQ.text: Very tasting wings, I prefer them to the tenders because to me, the wings have more flavor. I also like that the wings are breaded then fried so they are extra crunchy. I recommend avoid going in within 30 minutes or even an hour of closing. We got there a little after 7, got our food after 7:30, and were still chowing down around 8. The guys working there though were putting the chairs up the second customers leave the table. I understand there's a lot of prep work and cleaning they have to do after closing, but it made me feel like I needed to hurry up and get out of there. It also doesn't create a very welcoming atmosphere for customers who are coming in to eat.

LPXJRs_Qidk-c5Nbhnl3Wg.text: Fantastic! We used to get just the grilled chicken fingers as we try ro be health conscious, but the breading they use is very light and males the fingers come out delicious, the insides are moist and tender and break apart able to dip in their  multitude of fantastic sauces. Add on a giant beer for only $3 and this meal can't be beat!

ZkGivytKuSrHzJ3mL9De4w.text: This place was a good little eatery that offered a variety of items from chicken fingers, chicken wings, burgers, chili, etc. Of course we came to try to chicken fingers since that's what all the hype was about. Tried it slathered in hot sauce, which was good flavor... but seemed to be just like Frank's Red Hot sauce just not as spicy. The chicken was  dry, but still okay covered in sauce. I was pleased to have shoestring fries! They also offer a variety of other sauces either on the side or on your chicken. Next time I think we'll opt for on the side. Of course they offer the usual fixings of ranch, blue cheese, etc for dipping as well. This place can get busy though! We beat the crowd, but shortly after many people were looking for  table to sit at. Decent place to check out if you're in the area.

JGUNyexQQguEAwgxOFgBdQ.text: chicken wings are very good, tenders are okay. Good sauces (especially garlic honey), great fries. Good service.

xenkKx5vG6o5mVPpiWFqJA.text: I always get the 3 finger with fries and drink and normally it has four fingers in it. Four gigantic fingers. Delicious. Love this spot

kgdg_5vfIjFI9_lxeFWfRA.text: We eat here all the time - we drive across town to get our Chicken Shack fix! Best chicken fingers - fresh, juicy and thick. I always get the kids meal and am stuffed! Their fries are delicious. I don't know what they season them with but they're yummy! I've tried a lot of their sauces the habanero honey is my go to fave. Small place - always busy!

7dyil0urCLnaI9wrpt-adQ.text: Picked the wrong day to come try this place!!!!! Called in my order for myself and a co-worker and specifically asked for sauce on the sides. Drove about 6 miles to pick up and of course the orders were incorrect. The girl who was working the register at 12:10 pm was rude, arrogant and had a HUGE attitude when I told her the orders were wrong. She started to have MORE of an attitude when I asked for the manager and she said " anyways with you" which I thought was beyond disrespectful. A male chef came out and tried telling me that I didn't order what I said I did over the phone but yet I spoke to a female on the phone to place my order...how does that make any sense?? The male chef asked me what I ordered and I told him, he then went back to the kitchen and fixed my order. By the time my order was fixed I had already lost 23 minutes into my 45 min lunch break from work!! I will NEVER go back to this disrespectful place of business. On top of it all they screwed me out of a chicken finger when I ordered a 3 piece they only gave me 2 fingers and shorted out on the fries !!!!! This place sucks !!!!!!!

fc0g9cTHPi_xiAucXHL6gg.text: Its pretty bomb.  A little dive but man can they cook chicken.  They also have pitchers of beer.  It's pretty great sitting outside eating wings and drinking beer.  Small and cozy.  Jerked and hot teriyaki are my favorites bone in or out doesn't matter, along with some Alaskan Amber beer.  Yummy.
